38900782.review:
剧情：3 / 5
作为地球最后的恋爱物语，剧情并不算很出彩，
蓝本是好的，但展开不尽人意，
背景凄婉却缺乏情感的爆点，不过能把末世题材演绎得如此田园化也很不错。

音乐：3 / 3
Little Explorer很带感，bgm稍有平淡但整体很耐听，天门作曲一流。

画面：2 / 2
秒杀业界级别的op动画，我觉得比那个成本一亿的更好看。

综合：8 / 10
遥想中二社那年，七尾、天门、新海诚、酒井齐聚一堂，
搞出来这么一个全年龄、单线、没选项、宽屏的少数派作品，
一个简单、美好、寄寓minori之魂的故事，晚安，Sion.
后来的事情告诉我们，只要坚持理想，[spoiler]你总是会破产的，
纯粹坚持的中二社，怕是再也难见，当然，取而代之的欧派还是会有的×[/spoiler]

38733154.review:
Now, I'm not one for kinetic visual novels. I'm of the opinion that 'if I can't interact with the story, I might as well read a book or watch an anime'. And for the most part, this game hasn't changed that. I feel as though this would make an absolutely incredible anime series or movie, but instead it chose to take in the visual novel form. That doesn't mean this game is bad. In fact, far from it. It tells a compelling story of a soldier hired to guard a facility, but in the process he finds himself and what he's always longed for.

My breakdown:

PROS:
+Music. Quite possibly one of the best soundtracks I've heard in a VN. Some scenes are absolutely flawless, and the soundtrack really enhances the power it has. By far the best element of this VN. The reason it is not a 10 is because some of the songs I didn't feel fit as well as they could have.
+Art. Some of the best 2D CG's I've ever seen. Compelling, powerful and expertly done. The entire game is run on different variations of these CG's, so instead of having the normal renpy look, it has a completely unique feel.
+Characters. Every character is designed incredibly well. Lavie/MC's dynamic was quite possibly the best written companionship I've seen in ages. With that being said though, a few of the decisions and dialogue choices some characters make (Especially Inaba) feel out of place, and out of line.
+Voice actors. I don't speak Japanese, but even I could tell that the voices did fantastic performances for the most part. The MC's one in particular, was outstanding.
+Story. Act 1 and 2 were phenomenal. Great conflict, expertly crafted scenes, and intriguing characters made these two segments just insane.

CONS:
-Old engine. The game feels old. On a technical level, it's just no longer up to par. When right click opens a default Windows dropbox, it takes a lot out of the experience.
- Spoiled sections. The games subheading 'they were the only two, on the planet' kills a lot of the power Acts 3/4 should have. And I feel that it's unjustified like that. Same with the prologue, which honestly would have made the game so much nicer if it didn't exist. Act 1 is so great because we don't know what will happen, and the prologue spoils a lot of it.
- Kinetic novel. A problem for me, for the reasonings stated in the opening paragraph of this review.
- Slow. Act's 3/4 were sreally drawn out, and honestly could have been done in way less time. I felt that the last 4 hours of the game could have been done just as well in around an hour.

-Scores-
Story: 8
Characters: 7
Art: 8
Music: 9
Enjoyment: 7

Overall: 8/10

tl;dr a beautiful game, but would have worked better as an anime.

38702978.review:
那一年，身为萌新的我[strike]怀着某种邪恶的欲望[/strike]打开了Galgame这个新世界的大门，也是那一年，我有幸接触到了被各路大佬捧在手心里的神作——《Eden*》。

一路走来，不知道什么时候我已经沉迷[strike]黄油[/strike]文字小说游戏不可自拔，我曾爱过永远，恨过夜子，为莹感到失落，为星奏感到痛苦。然而现在，爱过了痛过了，再也找不到曾经心脏为她而跳，眼泪为她而流的感觉。也许我再也没有勇气，也没有理由去点开在硬盘里沉睡已久的她。但是对我而言，Galgame已经不仅仅是二次元里虚假的游戏，我的生活，已经在不经意间无法离开对我微笑的她。

我常常对初玩入坑作《Eden*》时抱有的邪恶念头感到介怀，也许这是我Gal史上最大的污点吧。记忆随时光悄然逝去，陪我一路走来的Gal的宝贵记忆如同小时候一起欢乐嬉戏，一起逃课，一起背锅的朋友一样，一个个远去。而《Eden*》却时常出现在我的记忆里，夕阳下银白色的长发随风舞动，《Sion》悠扬的音乐伴着那迷人的微笑却总是能将我的记忆带到几年前，带到那个即将毁灭的世界——还有比你的身边更让我心安的地方吗?

《Eden*》没有命运石之门那扣人心弦的剧情，没有nekopara那精美可爱的立绘，没有柚子社那让人心跳的人设。它有的，是令人感到幸福的日常。对我而言《Eden*》并不是悲剧，世界的终焉，能找到心的归属，能为她付出一切，能和她度过这一生最快乐的日子。还有什么能比这更让人满足呢？如果说《Clannad》是人生，那《Eden*》一定是梦，一个不愿醒来的梦。

[b]“煎鸡蛋做不出来了……对不起…”[/b]
[b]“一直照顾我的任性……对不起…”[/b]
[b]“没能陪伴你到最后……对不起…”[/b]

如果…如果能够进入你的梦…即使是末日…两人…一起…

38639132.review:
eden替换文件汉化： 下载此文件： https://pan.baidu.com/s/1i34Eg7r
将里头的内容复制到steam下载目录:\Steam\steamapps\common\eden里即可，方法由其他大神提供，使用后正常掉steam卡片，可能会偶尔报错停止游戏，记得经常保存即可。

eden在我玩过的那么多款galgame中也算是很特殊的了 ，原因如下：
1.男主有配音。
2.全程输出靠cg，基本上可以算是没有人物立绘，就靠着数量惊人的cg来表现一个又一个场景和发展剧情，在这些cg中人物的眼睛会眨，嘴型会根据对话而动，令人惊叹。
3.大跌眼镜的ui（用户操作界面）设计，屏幕下方除了对话框之外空旷一片，想要自动播放，保存，回到开始菜单基本全靠右键，把鼠标放到界面最右下方会弹出保存和读档等按钮（这个藏的好隐蔽，偶然才触发出来的），整体看来不是很方便。
4.目前来看相当便宜的价格，冬促六块购买或者去hb（https://www.humblebundle.com/games/mangagamer-and-friends-bundle）    一刀包6.66元购买任君选择。

 7.5/10

38569338.review:
[h1] eden*是一个很好的非互动视觉小说游戏。 [/h1]

这是一个在末日背景下，背叛了军队的军人与拯救世界的少女科学家的恋爱故事。
整部作品流程不长，从头到尾给都在铺设一个宏大的背景，但是却并不想过多地把情节浪费在背景的交代上。

不可否认，游戏氛围的烘托还是做的十分到位的，优良的bgm和cg也为此增添了不少光彩，不过最令我欣赏的还是是人设的创作，尤其是几位贯穿全作的配角，对于他们情感的描绘，细腻程度甚至不亚于男女主，最后不惜成本的动画ed也很好地完善了人物的形象。

把自己的弱小当作罪过，男主和少校都是抱着这份心意，走在属于自己的救赎之路上的。
那么，选择了为美丽的人而活着的男主，最后终于找到了自己活着的意义，作为向这个世界送别的人生活下去，在所爱之人的墓旁，轻轻地道一声:“晚安，诗音。”

[h1] 罪与惩罚是由当事人各自的尺度所决定的，我并不明白那份重量。[/h1]

38394723.review:
To be honest, this visual novel didn't catch my attention at first, but while reading it, I do start to appreciate the beauty of it.  eden* tells a lovely story by strengthening every characters vividly. It's turely beautiful to say that this story will move your heart at any point of your reading. I don't really like talking about contain of a visual novel to people who haven't experienced it themselves, so, if you enjoy gorgeous love story with dramas, give eden* a shot. You do not need to have the 18+ patch or read the X-rated version (PLUS＋MOSAIC) for this VN, The story itself is complete and uncuted on its own. There are some predictable outcomes you can guess along the reading, but minori does really a good job transition it. At some point, I would find that this is a good spot to end, and it won't be that emotional for me to take, but the game was like: but wait, there is more, we haven't squeezed out the last drop of your tear just yet. My eyes take some degree of physical damage after finishing it. If you can enjoy this beautiful sadness, it's the proof of being alive.

But overall, this novel is pretty dame good.
8.5/10

It'll take you somewhere between 10-15 hrs to read through the whole thing.

There aren't any choices and so its one straight story. Because of that there isn't much replay value.
But such things aren't so bad, so long as the content is good. And eden* has good content, so it's worth your time.

I don't remember if it was at the beginning section or middle, but there was a part that felt like... perhaps it went on for a bit too long? But thats fine, the rest of the VN made up for that. I felt connections to some characters such that when certain events happen, I wished things had turned out better for them than what had happened. I had actually felt invested in them. Yeah, I'd say eden* does a job well done in regards to overall story and characters. I certainly thank eden* for enlightening me with the fact that VNs were more than just that boring Sakura series. It comes fully recommended from me, especially if you're already into VNs.

38062614.review:
思来想去想评价点什么，但还是难表于文字。

题材是末日，其实也就是一开始就暗示了结局（实际上开头也毫不含糊的在明示）。
作为单线有声小说（弊端就不赘述了），且一开始就定了结局，且玩家实际上并不太能代入男主，把故事写好着实不容易，eden做到了，而且深入人心，至今还有很多人为女主SION祈祷晚安。

虽然故事定在末日这种宏大的背景，但游戏以小见大，只是简单展示了男女主最后那实际上不寻常的日常，其中再穿插一些关于这个末日的细节。但我认为这是反过来利用“地球末日里最后的两人”这种悲惨却浪漫的世界观，正因如此，日常才显得弥足珍贵。此外由于格局小，每个人物的角色性格更能细腻地体现出来。

cg以及配音我认为都是非常高的水准，CG精美的仿佛会让人认为这是在做一场梦，而配音方面我认为男主的CV演绎得很棒，把男主的性格诠释得非常出色。

BGM方面我个人是不太喜欢天门的，我觉得他真的除了钢琴一无是处。但这个题材用钢琴也没什么毛病，只能说无功无过。

我不会说这是神作，但如果半夜睡不着觉异想天开想体验一次末日之恋，这部作品我推荐给您，会让您做个好梦。

P.S.     这是英文版，可以贴吧下个汉化版直接覆盖文件

35899243.review: A kinetic visual novel by the folks at minori. It took me just over 13 hours total to finish, and was one of those well written VNs that leaves you never wanting it to end. The artwork and music are wonderful, but it's the story/writing that really sets this VN apart. I usually prefer non-kinetic VNs, but this one reads so beautifully, I was happy to forgo any decision making. The story itself revolves around a core of characters who are facing the impending end of the world.  I'll pass on giving a run down of the plot itself to avoid any potential spoilers. It delves into subjects such as redemption, love and loss, and the importance of cherishing what time one has left in life. If you're looking for a tear inducing read, this is for you. The VN is fully voice acted (in Japanese), and done really well, as is the translation through English subtitles. There are Steam trading cards for those who look for that, but no achievements. Absolutely recommended to any fan of VNs, beautiful writing, and/or emotional stories. If you're in any way on the fence about this one, make the leap. You won't be disappointed.

35894778.review:
As a visual novel, Eden is competently done, with good voice acting and amazing graphics, good sound design and music. Nothing excels between "competently made" and "good", but overall, the technical quality is there, absolutely.
What isnt there, however, is a compelling story.

I wont spoil anything, because there is nothing to spoil: this novel is exactly what it says on the tin. Tragic story, precious girl with (insert power \ ability here) and main protagonist (insert tormented past here) falling in love at the end of the world. That's it.
The story progression has no detours. The very beginning is promising, but there is nothing else to look forward to afterwards. It's all the same, same conversations, telegraphed encounter(s), trope-ridden small talk with little to no originality. It's your copy-and-paste novel with no redeeming qualities.
It should have been no more than 2 hours long, at best, maybe even Planetarian-sized. Then it would have been worth a read, although stereotyped, it might have been a small piece of literature to pass the time when on a flight or when on a train ride. Too bad it's more than 10 hours long, depending on the average reading speed of course, but it is still pretty long, definitely too much for how little it has going for it.
So at its current price tag, I cannot recommend this novel. You con find way better, for way less.

34771519.review:
地球最后的恋爱物语。一款温馨令人感怀的VN游戏。

故事大体讲述的是[spoiler]地球即将毁灭，人类决定要启动外星移民计划。作为首席科学家一直被当作工具使用的非人类智能型AI诗音便因此而存在，她竭尽所能促成了计划之后，怀着对自由世界的向往，在其生命最后一刻，她和男主角遁逃到了一个世外桃源。在有限温馨的日常之后，诗音大限将至。曾经采访过他们二人的记者将他们的感情故事谱写成了地球最后的恋爱物语。[/spoiler]

剧情虽然贫乏，但是并不妨碍作品整体。在华丽的人设，唯美的演出，完美烘托气氛的悦耳音乐，出色的声优助力下，剧情本身的弱势被无限缩小，其蕴含的温婉动人的感情被无限放大。所以我们会随着情节起伏不断调整自己的心境和状态，达成最佳的故事游玩体验。人物塑造上，作为男女主角的亮和诗音刻画非常成功，人物性格伴随剧情转变自然不突兀。心理状态和小动作的细腻描写让两位主角有血有肉，增进了玩家的代入感和亲切感。除开男女主角之外，一帮配角的设计亦非常出色，艾莉卡便是我在本作中非常喜爱的一个角色。他们的执着、痛苦、挣扎也让玩家感同身受，同时一些细节或者物件的描写让他们更加生动。这样的群像描写能力在VN中实属难得。文本技巧上，善用象征和草蛇灰线，让游戏具备多次游玩性，新一次的游玩会让玩家在发现这些剧本作家精心准备好的礼物时由衷感叹和敬畏。文本难度上，尽管实际上的故事内容简单，剧情长度合理，但是对于英文非官方语言的玩家而言，多多少少理解起来还是有些磕磕绊绊，过量的东方人的委婉以及大量的铺陈会使得相当一部人感到厌倦和懈怠。音乐上，除开完美烘托气氛外，有时候也同样起到象征和隐喻作用。

演出方面，Minori的实力大家有目共睹。作为业界最出色的美术团队作品，无论是新海诚贡献的可与电影演出比拟的OP，亦或是作品本身里截图可成壁纸的CG场面，甚至是罕见地引入动画制作中的一些岗位来完善游戏，这一切都不得不让人感叹后来Minori在《SPPL》上的折戟。“We always keep minority spirit.”，这句Minori网页上的标语现在看来有些触目惊心。我惋惜文艺社转向巨乳社，过去那种“愚蠢”而又带有艺术追求的执着，现代已是稀缺物。

[spoiler]评分：7/10 VN爱好者：9/10[/spoiler]

34524684.review:
После того, как высоко задрали планку качества minori, я не знаю, как мне в другие VN играть.
В этой новелле прекрасно всё: и музыка, и графика, и режиссура сцен, и то, что разработчики не скупились рисовать отдельные уникальные CG для сцен, которые, бывало, длились десяток секунд. Добавленные в сцены анимации лиц заставляют игру выглядеть уже больше похожей на аниме, чем на VN. Отдельно должен отметить отсутствие сцен-филлеров -- сюжет постоянно развивается, что-то происходит, нет разговоров ни о чём, и вообще разработчики очень уважительно относятся ко времени игрока и не пытаются ему показывать безделушки ради увеличения длительности чтения.
Почему-то у меня достаточно часто получалось, что кульминационные моменты в музыке совпадали с моментами в диалогах. Интересно, разработчики специально это рассчитали так?
После окончания чтения хочется верить, что загробная жизнь в мире игры существует, чтобы выполнившие свой долг и не отошедшие от морали персонажи смогли обрести счастье.

即使结局已经知晓，我也不愿放弃这感人的故事。从魔夜开始，自从几年前遇到了Narcissu，我就一直在寻找着什么。现在终于知道，我要找的正是eden*。于是，追寻的使命完成，我想将来会有好一段时间不会再接触galgame了。作为测评来说，这篇大概是不合格的吧，因为只是在说自己的事情。但是我觉得，有些作品的感受，终究只能深埋在心底。长年累月所积累的知识，伤痛，和感情，在被引燃的这一瞬间，别人终究是无法理解的。所以，如果你还没有放弃生活，仍然还抱有期望，那么请不要错过这款游戏。比起最后的结局，愿祝君能好好体会生活的美好。

34131864.review:
Let me start, this was an interesting and entertaining Visual Novel. I had a good time playing through it.
If you're expecting a fast-paced story, you should look somewhere else (probably something other than VNs generally). 
The story was not fast, like previously stated, but still not too slow. It's a game you can enjoy playing, it's not something you have to divert all your attention to. However, this does not mean that it does not have something special and intersting. It's a very typical romantic story, but with it own twists. 
I felt the game as a whole was very well excecuted. It's not a game that I would be able to finish in ''one sitting'', but it's still the type of VNs that I would come back to and complete.
The only drawback may be the pricetag, it can be a bit expensive.
I recommend this game to any VN-fan who has some interest in love-themed stories. I would advise if you're interested in picking this VN up, to wait for it to come on sale.

33459108.review: eden* is an excellent way to spend eight hours. As a sci-fi thought experiment, it builds an intriguing world and history and then fills it with characters you come to care about on a personal level. Likewise, the tragic romance of Ryo and Sion is one filled with believable drama and real dilemmas that have no easy solution. So while the end of the world is nothing new in science fiction, never before has it been quite so romantic.

第一次玩eden应该是13年左右，现在在拾起来重温心灵的震撼还是没有改变。
——Eden* They were only two,on the planet。
——那是地球最后的恋爱故事。
一开始玩这部作品的时候，老实说我并不是很接受。
【没有选项，没有个人线，这样的galgame肯定没办法刻画好人物的】
eden是我玩过的少数单线作品（单线galgame本来就不多就是了）之一，我认为是我玩过的单线游戏中最好的作品，甚至在我玩过的所有游戏中都可以称为佼佼者。
但比起galgame我更愿意把它规划为视觉小说。
op ed bgm都是相当出色的，背景和气氛渲染也是非常棒的。
【壊れかけた籠に 暗い闇が絡めた  鎖を解き放てば】
身为minori最后的辉煌，eden真的是不可多得的佳作。
悲伤，惋惜，感动。
最后那小小的幸福被毁灭的凄美。
当之无愧的-地球最后的恋爱故事。
为曾经的自己补票，以及给minori续一秒。

32637160.review: I gave up on this mind-numbing visual novel after about 3 hours.  The artwork is beautiful, but the writing is at the level of bad fanfiction.  I've written fanfiction.  I've read fanfiction.  I know what the bad stuff looks like.  Eden is such poor writing that I would be ashamed to post it.  What's wrong with the writing?  The characters are one-dimensional cardboard cutouts.  Ryou is a silent tough guy.  Always beholden to duty.  Lavie is a psychopath.  I saw two scenes of her pulling a weapon on Ryou that were completely pointless.  I get it.  She's nuts.  Sion is an eccentric genius.  Doc Brown had far more personality.  Many scenes are long-winded and tedious.  Some scenes come across as completely pointless.  I stopped caring when Lavie pulled the gun on Ryou.  Shortly thereafter I just quit reading.  I kept waiting for this visual novel to get more interesting.  It never did.

Dość przyjemna VN choć nie jest to jakieś mistrzostwo świata. Wciąż jednak jest na tyle dobra, że uznaję ją godną polecenia. 

Pierwsza część była najbardziej interesująca. Stopniowe odkrywanie fabuły i budowanie relacji między bohaterami czytało się całkiem fajnie. Druga część będąca zasadniczo okruchami życia jest już dużo mniej ciekawe i musiałem trochę zmuszać się by kontynuować. Na szczęście zakończenie było dobre i pozostawiło uczucie spełnienia więc powinienem dobrze wspominać tą VN. 

Może jeszcze wspomnę o kwestiach technicznych. Jest cała masa CG, ale w większości nie są one czymś na czym warto zawiesić oko. Muzyka gdy teraz słucham ją oddzielnie wydaje się być całkiem przyjemna, przy czym podczas czytania rzadko ją zauważałem. Można powiedzieć, że po prostu dobrze wpasowywała się w klimat, ale ja lubię jak muzyka bardziej się wyróżnia i sama ten klimat buduje. To jednak kwestia gustu. Jednego jednak nie mogę przemilczeć – co to za archaiczny silnik został użyty do zrobienia tej VN? Ani normalnego backlogu, ani wygodnej w użyciu funkcji ponownego odtwarzania kwestii. O takich 'nowościach' jak możliwość przeskoczenia do wcześniejszej sceny też można zapomnieć. Dodatkowo brak muzyki na ekranie tytułowym oraz wyłączanie muzyki przy przechodzeniu do menu? Ja rozumiem, że kilka lat ta VN już ma, ale aż taka stara też jednak nie jest... Jedynym plusem jest to, że normalnie z elementów interfejsu jest widoczne tylko okienko tekstu, bo łatwiej wczuć się w klimat gdy nic nie odwraca twojej uwagi. Wiele osób pewnie machnie ręką na powyższe marudzenie, ale mnie jednak do dość mocno irytowało.

Jeszcze jedno. Warto by było wiedzieć przed zakupem, że jest to przedstawiciel gatunku utsuge, więc nie należy się spodziewać happy endu. Plus jest to kinetic novel, więc jeżeli główna bohaterka nie przypadnie komuś do gustu to raczej nie będzie z lektury zadowolony.

31893007.review:
When I was a little kid, my mother told me not to look into the sun. So once when I was six I took the Captain Hook plastic spyglass that had served me so well, I took it and put my eye to it and pointed it at the sun. The overwhelming sensation, when it finally registers, is not entirely unpleasant. It is like being dragged slowly across a pane of glass. It is like licking almond scented sawgrass. Ecliptic after images, the light cuts spread eagles crossing slowly, vulturish, circling. 

The searing photonic stress had knocked me out. I awoke with little memory of the preceding hours, but the pink paisley bark on the trees around me unnerved me to no end. The grass underfoot crinkled oddly and when I knelt down to snap off a blade I realized it was plastic astroturf stuff. It tasted like lime and it stung like a mother. Florid fauna dappled with spots of what couldn't have been real sunlight filtered through tea leaves and steeped for an hour of northern-bound motion, I couldn't find no one but came to a road and turned towards my right unto what would be the sun if it wasn't so pink and cost less to come see. Patches of skin crisped melanomic and fell peeled like husks as I walked. The road was paved with candy.

That is what it is like to read this visual novel.

31887894.review:
A visual novel that easily makes it in my top 10 of stories I really like.

An hour after I finished it I am still a bit emotional, something that happens rarely.

PROS:
* Great story. (I had trouble shutting the game down after the first hour to go to bed for work.)
* Good art, nothing that really stands out but combined with the next point it is different than usual.
* Non-static characters, mouths and eye lids move compared to the static characters of most VN's.

CONS:
* Relatively short (it took me 9 hours including some short breaks).
(* Linear but that adds to the ability of the game to really build a bond with the characters.)

Would have loved to see a bit more background in the story and a bit more closure on the opening scene.

31792962.review:
直到她永久沉睡的那一天，世界啊，请你一定不要终结

《eden*》是日本电子游戏公司minori的第六部作品，Windows版本最初发行于2009年9月18日，包含十八禁内容的“eden* PLUS＋MOSAIC”也同时发行。2015年1月30日由MangaGamer发行英文版，登陆steam平台。目前具有漫画，互联网广播节目，音乐，社交游戏等周边产物。

《eden*》漫画原作为镜游，作画为守姬武士，由一迅社出版，在2009年8月-2010年3月连载于Comic REX。

游戏为恋爱冒险游戏，以主线叙事为主要剧情，包含各种战斗情节，玩家通过观看视觉小说来了解整个游戏，游戏具有单线结局，十八禁版本则增加了全年龄版不包含的十八禁相关内容。

在地球遥远的未来，由于火星附近出现巨大的能量体，使地球发生了各种变异，引发全球性的战争和恐怖主义，地球在毁灭性的打击下离灭亡只剩下100年。

为了赶在100年内离开地球，人类制定“地球脱出计划”。为了实现这个计划，建立“地球统一政府”以打压异己和集中一切可利用资源；另一方面，为了解决人类智慧和肉体的局限性以保证计划的延续性，又制定“地球脱出计划”的核心“Felix计划”——通过基因改造，获得高智能的长生不老的生命体，即“Felix”。本作的女主角诗音即为其中一名Felix。

第99年，撤出行动完全结束后，原特殊部队成员榛名亮被派往第703研究所，与诗音邂逅。而亮的任务就是守护这个为“地球脱出计划”奉献一生的少女，以及限制她的自由。后来在地球毁灭的最后时间里守护她前往死亡的乐园……

我想，这样就好。
在她进入最后的休眠的时刻，我就在她身边。
就算艾莉卡不在她身边，她也并非独自一人。
她一定不会寂寞的吧。
这种微笑，就是证明。
而且，也是我在这里的理由。
我一直在向往，寻求，拜托的答案，现在就存于此处。
所以，我只能说出一句话
只用一句话，告诉她。
晚安，诗音

I must admit  that I purchased this title, thinking it was an actual game during an Anime sale.  At first, I launched it a couple of times and didn't get past the first minute or two, but that's because I wasn't giving it the time of day.  And then... I did.  

The story is very moving.  Right down from the characters to the encapsulating music, you will get drawn in ever so gently.  Before you know it, you're asking yourself, "what happens next?"  There's a lot of love put into this story and it's told with such grace.   Those long, lost reminiscent feelings and ideals you may have felt at one point in life will be unearthed, if even just for a moment.   

So if you happen to stumble across this title, give it a shot.   No regrets.

29700603.review:
(IT)
Mi scuso di non rivolgermi all'utenza esprimendomi in inglese, ma preferisco parlare correttamente in italiano.

Tempo fa, nel periodo di saldi estivi, novizio come ero (e come in parte sono tuttora) nel vasto mondo delle Visual Novel, decisi di acquistare Eden* ... in quel periodo avevo altro da fare, e tra le mani avevo altre VN, quindi per un bel po' rimase fermo lì nella libreria di Steam, mai aperto, nemmeno la pagina iniziale, tenendolo quasi come un soprammobile polveroso adagiato e dimenticato in soffitta ...
Poi finalmente, mesi più tardi, decisi di iniziare: che dire, in parte mi pento di non aver iniziato a seguirlo fin dal suo acquisto; rimasi sorpreso, praticamente la gran parte delle VN che ho visionato non avevano una dinamica basata su degli sfondi così ben curati, ed è anche una delle poche in cui la visuale non sempre corrisponde al protagonista, ma talvolta si diventa un'osservatore estraneo (potendo quindi vedere la faccia e la fisionomia del personaggio principale). Quindi quanto alla grafica, nulla da ridire, anzi, complimenti a chi se ne occupato, davvero un ottimo lavoro, sfondi meravigliosi, luci ben gestite e personaggi ben curati.
La trama, sotto certi aspetti, può apparire semplice (addirittura banale per chi "consuma" abnormi quantità di anime/manga/VN/etc.), ma tutto sommato, l'ho apprezzata molto, in special modo per i rapporti che il protagonista ha con altri personaggi, e non mancano certo i colpi di scena; devo ammettere che il finale mi ha lasciato sorpreso, ha lasciato emozioni contrastanti, ma c'è da chiedersi ... va bene che finisca così? ... certo ... non pretendete il classico "e vissero tutti felici e contenti" perchè quì non lo troverete, a maggior ragione se si scorgono i tristi presagi di una "Bad End", e non essendo questo un Dating Sim, c'è poco da fare ... ma proprio il modo in cui è finito rende giustizia a quelle ore passate a seguire i dialoghi e le interazioni tra i personaggi, che in qualche modo dovrebbero annunciarvi la piega che prenderà la storia.
L'OST, dire che l'ho apprezzata sarebbe un eufemismo; sarà che, come tutte le VN, talvolta riprendono la medesima musica per ripeterla a "disco rotto", ma non mi è dispiaciuto; sopratutto la perla musicale che accompagna l'ending movie, qualcosa che ti dice "si, beh, forse non è andata come speravi, ma la vita continua, ci rialziamo, prendiamo a schiaffi il destino avverso e si guarda al futuro".
Unica cosa, per fortuna non mi sono scaricato la patch "+Mosaic" (ho visto solo qualche anteprima su un sito di terze parti), che praticamente aggiunge il lato ecchi/hentai che quì non è presente, in quanto penso distorca eccessivamente l'atmosfera e la visione che si ha dei personaggi, risultando spesso surreale e fuori luogo: mi sento di dover raccomandare fortemente all'astenervi da aggiungere tale patch al gioco.

Conclusione (parere soggettivo):
Eden* è una visual novel stupenda, che merita il tempo che ad essa ho dedicato, consigliatissima a novizi e non, perchè nel complesso, parlando di trama, personaggi, musica, grafica, etc. è un prodotto di qualità e degna di attenzione.

29629927.review:
伊甸园（Eden），在圣经中有“乐园”之意，也是传说亚当和夏娃的原居地。
而对于本作中即将毁灭的地球，eden自然意蕴无穷...
对生命的思考，对存在的认知，对自由与爱的歌颂。
eden，即使以现在的眼光来看，也无疑称得上是“神作”。
........................................................分割线.............................................................
人生的意义究竟是什么？人啊，难免迷茫和纠结。在这迷茫与纠结中，人生宛如在没有明灯的黑夜中孤独摸索，暗自痛苦。掌握答案之前，大概永远都无法解脱吧。
eden，我们从中找到各自的答案了吗？
【艾莉卡】
[生者，不管是谁，都有获取幸福的资格。我坚信着。]
此句贯穿《eden*》，无疑是线索般的存在，也揭示了这部作品之真谛。
eden中的每个人都以自己的方式追寻着作为生者的意义。
稻叶寻求救赎；
夏目渴望自由；
拉维追随存在的意义；
真夜贯彻着“真实”；
艾莉卡为诗音插上飞离牢笼的翅膀，实现了另种意义的永恒，她笑着离去，那份幸福感，是否能够传递的到呢？
诗音作为最高位Felix从诞生那一刻就注定了她所要背负的使命，被当作人偶为人类延续燃烧生命，她有力量结束这一切，但她没有那么做，为何？或许是想创造生者的意义吧。
命运的齿轮咬合，她与他相遇，一直埋藏于心中无法实现的愿望终于能实现，她化作了飞舞的迎风飘荡的蓝蝶于此天空自在起舞，伴着身边那道热光 ，直至燃烧殆尽....
地球最后的恋歌迎来最后的音符
おやすみ、诗音

.................................................................分割线.......................................................
评论中少有艾莉卡的影子呐，稍稍有点感伤，因此手打下段翻译，缅怀这份情感...

【艾莉卡】
[诗音...夏目...拉维酱...]
【艾莉卡】
[亮君...]
人们的脸不住的在眼前流过。
不断回忆起过去那些遥远的日子，感觉听到了让人怀念的声音。
少女用心听着那声音。
那声音--在召唤着自己。
非常非常温柔，温暖的声音。
少女微笑着，微微开口。
【艾莉卡】
[现在，可以走了...恩，没事的。我没有后悔]
【艾莉卡】
[是啊，这样就好了...]
少女用尽最后的力气，向天上举起了手臂。
在颤抖的手伸出前方，有着什么吗？
为了确定那个，少女的心飞向了天空--

29594660.review:
Personally, i dont write reviews for games or novels, but i have to make a exception for this novel because it was just that good. This Novel will send you through a multitude of emotions. Personally i am the type of person that does not show emotion twords games and novels alike, However eden* took me to the point of tears by the time i hit the end.


But aside from my opinion there are pro's and cons. 

Pros:
Depending on if you listen to all the voice acting or not it will give you 8-15 hours of time i would say.
If your human has the abilty to bring out emotions you thought nothing could.
The music mostly fits with the mood, and atmosphere.
The auto mode worked perfectly and its speed unlike some others was fantastic.
There are probably more but im stuiped and cant think of them :p
If you like to just sit back and watch then your all good cause it has no choices.
Is entirely voice acted.
Has almost 0 if no fan service at all.

Cons:
(Depends if you hate people seeing you in tears like me) Brings you tears in more than 1 part.
The auto mode dosnt work if you have 2 screens and click on the opisite one of the game.
Has no interaction and runs on its own (Aka a kinetic novel)
If your human has the abilty to bring out emotions you thought nothing could.
There are probably plenty more but not any more i can remember or reconize, also not once did i hit any kinda of bug or similar problem.

This is my first review, so excuse me if it sucked :P but i hope it does affect your choice into buying this 8/10 kinetic novel.

29391559.review:
eden* is a kinetic visual novel that tells the story of Ryou Haruna, a human who joins the military, and Sion, a felix-a genetically engineered human with intelligence that surpasses those of ordinary human beings. (For those unfamiliar with kinetic novels, it is like a visual novel but the player isn't given any choices to determine the direction of the story so it is like reading a book or watching a movie.) As I don't wish to spoil too much of the story (since this is a KN and all), I'll only give a very brief synopsis. Basically, Earth is about to meet a fatal catastrophe but as this has been forewarned, felixes are created to find a way to save the human race by building ships that will eventually take them to a new world. As Sion is the most gifted of these felixes, she is the one who comes up with the idea of the ships' engines and Ryou is assigned to guard her. 

Since I'll refrain from spoiling more of the story, I'll just get right to it and give my opinion. Despite that it's a KN, it's pretty lengthy so I didn't find it boring in the least. (Check my playtime to get an idea of how long it took me to finish it.) There are two arcs or acts in eden. I found the first one to be interesting of how Ryou came to work as a soldier in the research facility where Sion is. Once the second act came, I did find it slower but more emotional (although the first act was pretty emotional in some parts as well, especially towards the latter part). 

The art was beautiful and I do love the anime style used. However, I'll give a bit of a criticism. Even though I know this is normal in anime art, I find it a bit unusual when the guys tend to look like their age while the females look younger than their age. Of course, with the nature of felixes, this can be explained away but even among the normal female humans, they do look younger than their age so yeah. I loved the music and there were a lot of pieces so I have no complaints there. 

Overall, I enjoyed eden* and found it to be a very beautiful story. I did find the ending to be sad although it can also be looked at as full of hope. I did get a little tearful towards the end although I found myself crying more when I played To the Moon. Still, eden* narrates a lovely, romantic story and if you like a good story, then I recommend it. ^^

29366271.review:
Length: Short (2- 10 hrs)
Avg read: 5 - 6.5 hrs
Type: Kinetic Novel

Description: In the near future, an ominous red star suddenly appears in the sky. Its presence is about to bring about the extinction of all life on Earth. The unified government proposes an evacuation project to take all of mankind into space, but in order to make the seemingly impossible project a reality, 'felixes' are brought into the world. Engineered to be highly intelligent with perpetual youth and longevity, the genetically modified superhuman felixes stand as humanity's only hope for survival.

Sion, the most gifted of the felixes, has been kept in a research facility built on a solitary island for the past hundred years. Her sole purpose, saving all of humanity. Ryou Haruna, a soldier from the Earth's unified government is sent to watch over Sion, who desperately seeks freedom from the military that's imprisoning her. Earth's last love story is about to begin. 

Overall: I really don't think Haruna "earned" Sion's love but its a bitter sweet love story. Longer than I thought the story would be and felt dragged on for myself. Worth the money though.
7/10

29277533.review:
お休み，シオン。ありがとう。
Sweet dreams, Sion. Thank you.
晚安，诗音。谢谢你。

——一周目通关感言

二周目通关的我，看着一年前我用诗音的语言、一周目的游戏语言和我的语言写下的感言，真是特别。

看着重新恢复生机的家园，未能如期到来的末日，留在地球上守护爱人的少年和在太空中遥寄祝福的两位少女，这个故事依然触动着我。没有丛生的悬念，也没有迭起的高潮，那份真诚和默然的守候却会成为人类永恒的话题。

若用一句话评价这个故事，我会选择这么说：
[b]“eden*是一次伟大的科幻浪漫思想实验。”[/b]


[h1]不剧透剧情简介及评价：[/h1]

本作讲述的是在世界末日背景下的拯救人类的天才少女科学家和背叛军队的军人少年的故事。

在初始剧情时间点的大约100年前，宇宙中出现了一颗人们从未见过的赤色彗星，一位科学家预言地球将会在100年后遭遇不可避免的大灾害而毁灭。不久后该预言得到了科学家们的证实，各国也因食物等资源问题爆发世界大战。待大战结束后，世界人口已经减半，人类意识到自己正在加速走向灭亡，于是世界各国组建了一个统一政府，并开始酝酿“地球脱出计划”。

为了完成这项宏伟的计划，科学家真行寺博士通过基因改良设计了一种高智商新人类Felix以协助设计计划中的各个系统，让星际旅行成为可能。

在故事的开始，地球已经进入末日倒计时，大部分人类已经撤离地球。原特种部队GAT成员榛名亮被派往第703研究所，并与女主角诗音邂逅。榛名亮的任务就是守护这个为“地球脱出计划”奉献了一生的Felix少女，以及，限制她的自由……

诗音是“地球脱出计划”的核心人物，也是在大部分人们眼中近乎神话的人物。但在政府和军队眼中，她只是一枚政治和军事上的棋子：政府需要利用和限制她的声望，军队需要限制她的自由以确保计划的顺利进行。诗音从小便被困在研究所内，生来背负着拯救人类的使命，在计划快要结束的时候，她想要完成自己一直以来想要获得自由的愿望。

榛名亮是个军人，在姐姐夏目被抓捕后，为了能够再次见到她开启参军生涯，在7年内屡立战功，成为一名优秀的特种兵。他原本是个唯命是从的军人，却在诗音身上寻找到自己的价值所在：给予她自由。

随着时间的推移，世界和诗音消逝的日子越来越近。身为守护者的亮面临着选择：如果他搭上最后一班移民船，那么他便会有新的生活，而诗音将在地球上独自面对死亡；如果留在地球照顾诗音，那么诗音会多活一段时间，而亮也会面临和诗音相同的命运。不管如何选择，结局似乎都不会像理想中的愉快。

本作没有选项，因此互动性为零，是一部单纯的视觉小说。总体来说，剧情节奏较慢，后期剧情几乎被日常填满，却对人物刻画得十分到位：亮对姐姐夏目的怀念，诗音和艾莉卡之间的亲人关系，稻叶少校对夏目的愧疚，拉维的率真与坚持，真夜的热情与真诚，这些有血有肉的人物为这个总体略显致郁的故事无疑注入了生机与活力。本作并不像普通的galgame那样主要拍摄人物正面躯干，而是有许多特写镜头、人物背面镜头等，镜头感十足。
http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=1231496096

Normally, I do not really write reviews - i rather tend to read others.
But - as I just have finished this excellent VN, I have to put my thoughts into words here for everyone out there who might be wondering if it is worth to get this piece of art.

To keep it short: This VN is simply a masterpiece.

The art.
The soundtrack.
The animation.
The story.

It will blow your mind as you read through the ~10 hour long story.
As it has a rather slow and long start, it starts off to get really intense and emotional mid/end part.
This is one of the most beautiful love stories I have ever read - and one of the most tragic one's.
Be prepared to get your heart filled with emotions - joy, passion, anxiety, sorrow - it is all packed in this masterpiece.
The soundtrack combined with the carefully animated graphics with full voice over will bring you to tears - in a good way.

Right now I am still listening to the very very good sountrack and thinking about the story and the tragic fate of a young love.
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-12TJyLvkVg

TL;DR: Grab a copy as soon as possible, every passionate VN lover should read this.

28795673.review:
朋友传教赠送了我这部作品，虽然在这之前我不小心自己推掉了噗......_(:з」∠)_

游戏本身剧情优秀，虽然不长，但是诗音和男主亮的故事真的很感人，其中穿插了姐姐夏目、女仆艾莉卡、同事拉维和记者真夜的感情经历。虽说在现在看来可能稍微有点老套，但是绝对不显得乏味空洞，相反仍然有较强的感染力。单线剧情整体体验时间在六小时左右，一口气推完感觉很舒服，之后回顾剧情又有点淡淡的感伤，[strike] 诗音QAQ	[/strike] 感觉再说下去要剧透了......剧情我给9分！

CG量大，质量可，基本没有明显的崩坏情况，但是重复的CG也较多，画风虽然有点老但是个人很喜欢！很喜欢|！喜欢！欢！8.5分。

话说男主有配音哦~~一开始可能有点不太习惯，但是适应后意外觉得不错哟~~_(:з」∠)_，BGM也总是能在合适的场景里触及我感伤的薄弱点，但是也仅此而已，8分。_(:з」∠)_

其实本来不想提游戏性的，但是现在许多玩家对这一方面要求越来越高，所以在这里强调一下：本作品无选项支！无选项支！是单线剧情的纯VN游戏。所以那些喜欢喷“跟看动画一样，无聊”的人请不要买了，不然又是一波差评。

可惜的单线剧情主要是关于诗音的，这就意味着即使其他女性角色好感度爆炸也无法攻略了_(:з」∠)_ 虽然也很喜欢诗音，但其实我在本作最喜欢的是艾莉卡555555

结论：优秀的纯视觉小说游戏，剧情感人，角色设定鲜明，CG可，BGM有感染力，整体8.5分。
喜欢galgame的玩家可以入，适合新手入坑作，不嫌弃作品老的剧情党建议入！但是本作无选项支，单线结局，且无STEAM成就，追求性价比的玩家建议自行考虑。中二社早期还不是巨乳社，喜欢看球和小黄油的玩家就不建议入了。

28199779.review: eden* is an excellent way to spend 40 hours. As a sci-fi thought experiment, it builds an intriguing world and history and then fills it with characters you come to care about on a personal level. Likewise, the tragic romance of Ryo and Sion is one filled with believable drama and real dilemmas that have no easy solution. So while the end of the world is nothing new in science fiction, never before has it been quite so romantic.

28165552.review:
This review reflects my personal opinion and is by no means made to provoke the author of this game or its readers.
Eden is a kinetic novel, thus lacking any interaction with the story, the plot is simple but manages to be unique in its own way, yet I don't feel like recommending this visual novel because I believe it presents a number of flaws that annoyed me to the point of making me want to uninstall it from my HDD. The game felt nice in the beginning, I said nice because it doesn't hold a candle compared to the other VNs I read, but neither belongs in the trash, my positive opinion carried on until a certain moment in the game, perhaps near the end, either way, I can guarantee it's definitely after the first half of the story, but back to the main point, the game turned into a real chore, I couldn't stand the boredom anymore, these accurate and vivid "descriptions" lasted far too long and there was no story progression overall, in addition, what makes it even wrong is the inaccurate timing of the backstories, which are told too late in the game, making it seem even more dull and boring rather than the opposite.

In other words, *eden completely and utterly failed to captivate my attention, making me fall asleep more than twice during reading.
When I asked for something lighthearted to read, I was hoping to find something that would hook me at least for two weeks or more, but unfortunately the game doesn't appear to be my cup of tea. Luckily, I didn't buy this game at its full price, but in my modest opinion, this game isn't worth more than ten bucks.

27619469.review:
首先，感谢Ayaya赠送，这久闻大名的作品
提到minori社，我所接触的作品顺序是这样的：
夏空的英仙座（夏空のペルセウス）、12月的夏娃（12の月のイヴ）、永不落幕的前奏诗（ソレヨリノ前奏诗）
最后...便是eden了，尽管这是09年的作品，但是画风依然算是非常好的，还有BGM，当然，最出色的的是剧情，
不同于以往所接触的galgame，本作男主也是有好好配音的，不过我却并没有感到不适，非常好的将我代入了进来。
诗音（cv：志村由美）的声音非常耐听，毫无疑问的是很喜欢，也是促使我通宵推完这部作品的动力之一。
围绕着将生命完全奉献给了地球脱出计划的少女们，讲述了一场地球最后的恋爱故事。
这是我目前接触过的最打动内心的交互式小说游戏，每一个角色塑造的都非常的好。
在后面的时间中，欣赏CG以及BGM都是如此的美好。
最后的最后，合出五级的徽章

晚安，诗音。

I don't usually play Visual Novel games but this one seemed appealing. The voice acting is really nice, all the actors have really nice voices to listen to. The art is incredible, and there is a gallery to review all the panels you have seen. Navigation is easy and you can go back panels if you missed/misread something.

This is ONLY a story. There is no gameplay/decision making involved. The story is about a genetically enhanced girl and her bodyguard. It's a fantastic read and I highly recommend it to people who enjoy stories.

    エンドレスブルーのうめきが明るい空は、まだで満たされたあなたの影スプリングを振って草を吹く風が、私は、臭いあなたが把握する必要があり聞こえてきそう、それは私が世界で臭いがするものであることを忘れないでください振り回さ最も美しい香りの一つはあなたと私の味です。私はあなたのための準備ができています。・私はあなたがどこに行っていない、私はあなたのために部屋に移動し、あなたの枕の上に椅子枕にやった、あなたの笑顔を欠場し始めます、あなたが目を覚ますので、私はあなたの側に同行します、あなたは私のすべての分、毎秒が苦しんでいるにもかかわらず、あなたが目を覚ます次回に沿ってあなたに同行するために待っている、彼の口を拭い、薬を与え、ことができたが、それは価値がありました。
   
   無意識のうちに、私はこの手紙を書いて、涙が流されてきた、私はそれが幸せか悲しいであると言うことができない、またはあなたが欠場する必要があります。あなたの甘い笑顔にキスを、あなたの体格の手をロールアップし、それは心の底からユニークな喜びです、あなたが目を覚ますために私は、世界の終わりまで待って、今私たちの「家」はとても美しいです私はなぜ揚げ卵はあなたが少し私をだます与えるか···あなたはどのように愚かを食べていない、あなたが薄いボディを持っていることを覚えておいてください。・栄養を追加ウェイクのを待って、おいしいの多くを植え··私はそれを行っていません。
  最後に、病弱なまたは私は快適に眠って床を取りに来た、あなたばか音詩····それは場所に属している私たちの2つだけです。おやすみなさい、音詩。おやすみあなたの音詩。
   どのように私はあなたが笑顔見てみたいです！どのように私はあなたの声を聞いてみたいです！でもどのようにどのようにどのようにどのように幸運が苦しむの後に！私は喜んで喜んで喜んで喜んで喜んで！

26730179.review:
[h1]Eden[/h1]
« The final love story on a dying planet » voilà qui résume assez bien cette histoire visuelle futuriste. Vous incarnez Ryou Haruna un soldat affecté dans un centre de recherche à la protection de la brillante Sion, à l’origine du projet d’évacuation. 
Graphiquement sur steam on trouve peu d’histoire visuelle de cette qualité, Eden vous donne une vraie claque, il est sublime des personnages jusqu’aux paysages et décors. 
L’histoire malgré quelques petites longueurs est très belle et riche en émotion. On s’attache à chaque personnage et mon plus grand regret est de ne pas avoir le choix surtout que par moment l’histoire nous taille de vraies portes de sorties vers d’hypothétiques fins alternatives qu’on peut imaginer mais malheureusement pas vivre. Certains personnages auraient mérité qu’on passe plus de temps avec mais le choix des auteurs reste néanmoins le plus évident. 
La musique est superbe est pas mis en boucle abusivement, on ne s’en lasse pas et elle colle parfaitement à l’ambiance.
Pour ma part j’ai mis un peu plus de 20h à aller jusqu’au bout mais je ne suis pas spécialement à l’aise avec l’anglais, j’imagine que pour un bon lecteur çà se fait en 10-15h. Le prix peut paraître du coup un peu abusif mais vu la qualité je préfère mettre 20euros pour encourager ce studio plutôt qu’acheter 4 histoires fades et sans intérêt à 5euros. Cependant on le trouve assez facilement en solde alors autant en profiter. 

[h1]En conclusion :[/h1] 
A part l’absence de choix qui aurait pu permettre de développer d’avantage certains personnages auquel on a juste le temps de s’attacher ainsi que de proposer des fins alternatives je ne trouve aucun défaut à Eden. Un vrai petit bijou visuel agrémenté d’une histoire intéressante et riche en émotion que je recommande à tous les amateurs d’histoire visuelle.

[b]Bilan : 9.5/10[/b]

[h1]English summary :[/h1] 
Aside a lack of choice wich might have allowed to explore more deeply some characters and to offer others endings, Eden is absolutely flawless. Amazing art with an interesting and emotional story that i highly recommend for fans of visual novels

26613545.review: I cannot fault this VN, the story is brilliant, the art is lovely and the fact you see your character in pictures makes it feel like you're more than just a random voice. I almost pride myself on showing about as much emotion as a very disinterested potato but this legitimately had me on the brink of tears in a few places. 12/10 would recommend

26537080.review:
第一次碰到这游戏还是高中吧，在某杂志送的光盘里遇见的。 当时虽然点进去玩了一会，但是不知道为何，当时的自己觉得这游戏是如此的漫长，一句话一句话看下去对于当时的自己似乎是一件很难的事情，总之玩到不到一半就去玩其他游戏了。虽然也不想责备那时自己为什么没有玩下去，也许那时的自己有的东西无法理解吧，
    而现在的自己，已经根本玩不动枪车球这样的游戏了。所以就想起，该静下心来回去玩一下那些早就该玩的作品了。于是，两天晚上，就过完了eden*的全部剧情。当初觉得如此长的剧情，居然现在觉得很短很短。
[u] 剧透注意 ネタバレ注意： [/u]
   [spoiler] 陪伴一个人走到尽头，在以前水仙里也玩过，个人也是挺对这内容苦手的（挺怕会哭的很惨w）。的确，结尾部分是哭的不行，不过总体来说这并不是伤心，而是对如此美好结局的感动。至少结尾的所有角色都是抱着希望的，sion也是充满幸福地离开的。是啊，不仅爱着的人陪她走到了最后，而且她和他的故事并不是随着这颗星球的灭亡而永远的消失，而是一定会由maya将他们的故事传承下去。这结局并不孤单，而是充满着希望。在maya的努力下他们的故事也会成为在宇宙中探索新世界的人们的动力之一吧。 [/spoiler]
   音乐和作画很棒，即使win10不能全屏玩，但是窗口模式下依旧可以感受到演出的高超。游戏里营造的那种雰囲気，让人也是很自然地就融入了进去。游戏里sion以及所有角色地表情都是生动的，有时真的感觉和角色之间屏幕的距离已经消失，而自己就在那里見守る着这一切，这有些悲伤，但还是无比充满希望的故事。天门的音乐太棒了，lear earth这曲子更是衬托出了那种希望感.

If you're wondering why I'm reviewing this despite a low play time, I usually play this when I'm away from an internet source. I have more or less gotten through halfway of the story, and man, it is so wonderful. 
The art holds some sort of angelic resemblance to paintings, and the lighting helps it gain more... aesthetic beauty. The story trope can be considered a classic, but it does not give the cliche feel. The soundtrack also helps in drawing the player more and more into the game, where you can peek at the everyday lives of the characters. 
All in all a very good game, I would recommend it to everyone who loves visual novels. If you're a beginner to this kind of game, hop on! Eden* can be a good starter for you!

清新的画风配上动人的BGM，讲述着一个简单而悲伤的爱情故事。整个故事凄婉动人，就如同预想的一般。不过结局出乎意料地没有定格在“晚安，诗音”这个悲伤的瞬间，而是传达出了希望。尽管家园即将被毁，前路茫茫不可知，人类还是多带了点面包，乘上宇宙飞船踏上新的旅途，展望着未来，也铭记着地球上那最后的爱情故事。而男主人公布榛名亮，明明在将要毁灭的星球上茕茕孑立，明明最后的恋人也撒手西去，依然坚强地稍微试着活下去，与伊甸里的灵魂一起见证世界的毁灭，甚至母鸡也受到激励顺利地产下鸡蛋。在最悲痛的时刻过后依然保持生的希望，这是最令人动容的坚强。

26055367.review:
Where to start.

Despite you knowing then ending from the very beginning, learning of the journey that brought them here was still sad. I shed a few tears, I probably would have cried more if I allowed myself to, but for some reason I am seldom to do so, even in private. You do not have to make any choices, so it plays out like a movie. For twenty dollars this is definatley worth it. From beginning to end the artwork was beautiful, the music carresed the ears, and the dialouge never seemed forced. I have not played many VNs, but this is number 2 on my list of favorite VNs. I found it unique that there was lip syncing, no matter how small the character was in the shot, and the eyes always blinking, making the image feel like more than just a static image. This VN has nothing to disapoint you with. In the end, I was satisfied with the ending, no ends were left untied. This was truley a masterpiece of a Visual Novel.

第一次玩中二社的eden已经是八年前的时光了，今天重回游戏仍然是让我震撼不已，打完这个游戏的时候已经凌晨三点，大脑任然在思考着这部作品。比起minori作品来说这部作品更加细腻，反而剧情较短 ，出场人物少却性格鲜明。它不仅仅讨论了恋爱物语，更是把人性理性构造在一起放在结尾给玩家思考。女主角Shino，不同寻常的身份，娇小细腻逞强性格，接受自己身份的无奈，最后坦然的面对自己的心情，确确实实的抓住了我的心。
总体来说，中二社这部作品完成度是相当成功的 作画优秀  声优满分 是值得推荐的好的作品。最后的最后我放下身旁的咖啡，夜已深，轻轻地道一声：Shino~おやすみなさい~

[b]eden*[/b] is absolutely wonderful;  spellbinding, emotional, immersive and a taste of Minori (visual novel company) at their finest.

It's all too easy to simply get sucked into the story and the lives and feelings of the main characters.  You can't help but cherish the precious memories accumulated throughout the story.

The soundtrack encompasses the magnificently lush, the hauntingly melancholic and the menacingly chilling, always capturing the mood to perfection.

Need I say how beautiful the artwork and character designs are?

Of course, not all is perfection. The load/save/help interfaces feel a bit Win 98, but they work just fine, and don't detract from the overall enjoyment.

…………
[b][晚安……Sion。][/b]

这个……我想一点评测的样子都没有吧，文笔也烂，甚至还直接照搬了游戏中的对话。但是，这些对话是让我对这个游戏的感受最强烈的，难以忘怀的。
孤独的两人互相吸引，同情，互相替代着对于自己最重要的人，直至真正的相恋。
Sion渴望着自由，所以也深知自由的珍贵，她不希望亮因为“守护”而被束缚在自己身边。比起行将就木的自己，亮有着更多的未来，自己羡慕且无法企及的未来。
这是Sion的希望，也是最后的愿望。
好吧，剧透就到此为止，不看黑条的内容的话，也很难懂得以上说的什么吧？
说实话，对于Eden的制作公司啊、发售日什么的，我并不了解（其实是懒得不去搜）
画风精致，几乎每一个画面都能当做壁纸来用，虽然开了全屏之后就惨不忍睹了（这并无大碍）
剧情并没有支线可选，也没有H的场景（真心的讲，没有H部分出来毁气氛真是太好了，如果对于那样的Sion还H的出来……那么我会立刻删游戏。）
音乐方面……据说是有新海诚老师的参与？这个我不太清楚，也就不多说了。每一个曲子，听起来就像是交响乐一样，动听而磅礴。
总而言之，如果喜欢GAL的话，Eden是绝对推荐的！

25389255.review:
Un très bon VN et, qui plus est, relativement court par rapport aux ténors du genre.

Pour ce qui est des personnages, tandis que certains manquent clairement de profondeur, d'autres sont vraiment intéressants et attachants. Le suivi de ces derniers au cours du scénario est très bon, aucun d'entre eux n'est complètement oublié au fil des évènements.

Le scénario quant à lui est intéressant, bien écrit et bien ficelé, bien que loin d'être révolutionnaire, mais avec un problème de rythme. 
La première partie du VN propose une intrigue très correcte et bien rodée, mais la deuxième partie abandonne toute intrigue pour laisser place à du [i] slice of life [/i] que j'ai trouvé un peu longuet alors que je suis généralement client du genre.

Malgré celà, eden* brille par sa qualité graphique. En effet il y a un nombre hallucinant de CGs par rapport à la durée du titre, ces dernières comportant pour la plupart un grand nombre expressions faciales et étant visuellement réussies. Les sprites des différents personnage sont globalement très beaux et variés. A celà s'ajoute de nombreux effets visuels renforçant le tout : lueur autour des personnages, gestion du flou... ainsi que la mise en scène gérée parfois de manière cinématographique, ce qui est plutôt rare dans un VN (ou tout du moins ceux que j'ai lù jusqu'ici).

Au niveau de l'ambiance sonore et de la musique, c'est correct. Le sound design fait très bien son travail tandis que les musiques sont pour la plupart oubliables, bien qu'elles remplissent très bien leur rôle et donnent un ton particulier aux scènes.

Néanmoins, eden* m'a marqué par son ambiance, qui se ressent comme un tout, à travers la fusion de sa musique, de son [i] voice acting [/i], et surtout de sa direction artistique, qui dégagent une impression onirique tout au long des deux parties du jeu.

-

En conclusion, eden* est, malgré un rythme assez inégal, un très bon VN, possédant un univers intéressant, un scénario correct, des personnage attachants, étant sublimés par une réalisation et une technique vraiment excellente qui justifie pleinement, à mon sens, de s'intéresser au titre. Attendez-vous à verser quelques larmes si vous êtes du genre émotif, mais à vous ennuyer passé la première moitié si vous ne supportez pas les [i] slice of life [/i].

> Ce sera 8/10 pour moi. [i] (toujours en considérant ce jeu en tant que Visual Novel, et sur une échelle acceptant les 10/10.) [/i]

25259037.review:
La vie, la mort, l'amour, la fin.
Pour ceux qui avaient perdu leur âme, s'approcher de la mort leur a permis de vivre.
Et ainsi, ils furent deux sur la Terre.

Revenons à nos moutons, c'est l'heure du jugement de ce roman visuel !
Graphismes : 9/10, les dessins sont vraiments magnifiques et invitent au rêve, sans toutefois relever du "chef d'oeuvre".
Scénario : 7/10, le scénario est intéressant, mais manque de quelques rebondissements et imprévus. De plus, l'évolution peut parfois paraître un peu lente.
Personnages : 7/10, les personnages sont attachants, mais on met du temps à éprouver cet attachement. Et une fois ce dernier éprouvé, on souhaite plus de détails qui n'arriveront malheureusement pas en nombre suffisant.
Musique : 9/10, la musique est juste excellente. Il y a cependant quelque moments de blanc musical. Cela a sans doute pour but de donner un effet, mais un meilleur effet aurait pu être donné avec des sons adéquats. Un bon point cependant est le nombre relativement important de phrases doublées.
Note globale : 8/10, ce roman visuel s'apparente à une ballade sur ordinateur. On n'incarne pas les personnages, on les observe plutôt évoluer dans ce monde violemment calme.
A conseiller aux amateurs un minimum aggueris de romans visuels qui pourront apprécier sa poésie à sa juste valeur.

25039516.review:
***THE LAST PART OF THIS REVIEW CONTAINS MINOR SPOILERS***

EDEN* is a visual novel about a romance that slowly blossoms in the face of an ending world.

EDEN*: The Positives and Negatives

+ Very good writing, feels very authentic a lot of times.
+ Beautiful imagery.
+ Amazing soundtrack, that, despite looping a little, never gets old.
+ Great middle part, this part is almost perfect in my opinion.
+ Interesting main protagonists.

- The first 1-2 hours of the story aren't the most interesting and, honestly, got boring at times.
- Half of the cast are forgettable, and not present for long.
- I know it's a visual novel, but this game would be so much better with a "choose what path you wanna take" style gameplay involved. The ending in particular seems to be able to move in many directions that all seem awesome, so interactivity would have been very much welcome.

Overall, if you like visual novels, this one is very solid. 



***MINOR SPOILERS WILL APPEAR FROM THIS POINT***

Personal Opinions:

I liked EDEN* a lot. I spent about a day playing through it, and I do not regret doing so. It's a great experience, but it's not without flaws. I'll praise the game first though. The writing is solid. It's suprisingly authentic, and you really believe a lot of the conversations the characters have. The music is f*cking amazing, and I could listen to the OST for hours. This also goes for the beautiful scenery and overall visual presentation of the game. The most important thing in the game is the love story between out two protagnonists and, honestly, it's really heartwarming. It never really delves into creepyness or goes to another extreme, the love story is right where it should be.

Now let's talk about some of the negatives. The first 1-2 hours spent inside of the facility are boring. Plain and simple. Sure, we get the necessary information about the characters... but that's it. Nothing else. The story only gets amazing when the perspective shift solely to our two protagonists, but it just only happens after a mediocre at best opening. Also, the ending. Now I know, this ending made people cry, and the love story was indeed, pretty tragic. So why didn't I cry? Simple. I kept thinking about other possible endings that made more sense in my head, espicially after they threw in the detail that one of the characters "had a wish to see the protagonist one last time". Instead, the ending we get it the one where the protagonists stay together, removing any logic from that scene where it clearly shows that the side characters are concerned. If you want us to care about the side characters, don't base the ending SOLELY around just the protagonists. If you want us to care about the protagonists, don't throw in statements about the side-characters, focus on the main two! 

So, after all that ranting about the ending, do I hate it? No. I just got really confused by the writing near the end, but I think I'm probably the only one to do so. I had the same reaction to the ending of Life is Strange, which people seemed to love, but I didn't. Most people will fall in love with the ending, if they don't tend to overanalyze things like I do. The ending is still heartwarming and indeed sad, and you'll probably shed a tear or too.

Not to mention that the 3-4 hours between the beginning and ending are the best parts of the game. They are so perfectly written, deciding to focus on the main characters, rather that dragging in several other characters, like the beginning and ending did. This part is what I love most out of the whole game.

In conclusion: While the beginning fails to completely impress me, and the ending is quite confusing in terms of the direction it really feels comfortable going in, I still had a lot of fun with EDEN*. In the end, it is the writing that makes a visual novel, and the writing is fantastic. The "visual" part of visual novel, the scenery and the music, are also breathtaking on their own. I wrote alot about the ending of the game, and how I wish it had more choices, but in the end, it's still a good ending. I'm probably also the only one who think it isn't perfect, so don't mind my opinion too much on that point.

EDEN* is a game I recommend to any visual novel-lovers, fans of love stories or simply bookworms. It's a great tale, that is worth playing through. If you aren't completely sure, wait for a sale, and it will DEFINENTLY become worth the amount of money you pay for it.

8/10

25023966.review:
That sinking feeling of impending doom never stops. It's like day 3 of majora's mask, except extended for like 8 hours.

The main theme would be "(no)Regrets" and "Accepting the inevitable", but taken to extreme levels.
If you have trouble coping with any of these, I wouldn't recommend going into this unprepared.
Regardless of previous experience with sad novels, eden* had me crying internally halfway through even before the sad events happened because I wasn't expecting plot curveballs and indeed, they never came. The reader is given the burden of shouldering all of the characters' emotions, building up to an obvious tearjerking ending that unfortunately, couldn't be happier.

It does exactly what you expect, but does it brilliantly. The voice acting is extremely well executed and caught me off guard a couple of times with it's subtle but noticeable emotional nuances not written in text. Coupled with the characters themselves, it actually had me paying close attention to their voices to try and catch on their hidden meaning.
The CG's are beautiful and do a great job at drawing you in with the extra animations every now and then, complementing it's artistic value with a more lively style of representing the scenery.

This might be a recommended from me, but it can be a tough one to chew for some especially if you identify yourself in some of the presented situations.

To summarize: 
eden* is a sad Love story about regret, atonement and -more than one kind of- acceptance. Boasts an immense artistic value from it's execution and leaves the reader with lingering feelings unique from what other nakige provide.

A good experience for my friday night. Shion is best.

24979598.review:
突然想起来村上在挪威的森林卷首的那句话，献给许许多多的祭日。
  Eden的这个评测拖了应该有了两年了吧。说起来是评测吗？大概是个自己一个交代。这两年间不断的动笔不断地搁置，因为各种各样的事情正如此刻这句话已经修正了很多遍一样，很难将这片评测进行下去。
  但是随着世间的流逝，我实在不敢保证以后有机会完成这篇评测。正如在人生最黑暗、精神最脆弱的时候某人之于我，Eden同样在那个悠久的夏日夜晚对我产生了深远的影响。
  如果说Minori前期游戏的主题是什么的话，大概就是“拯救”和“救赎”。
  作为Minori所广为人知的两部游戏，悠久之翼和Eden来说。没有得到拯救的优子却拯救了悠久之翼里面的每一个物语；同样没有得到拯救的Sion却拯救了整个星球。
  但是，”救赎“呢？用一句话来说就是没有得到拯救的救赎才是最为美好的救赎，残酷的结局却又也是得到拯救的结局。
  因为是“救赎”，所以开始便存在着“罪”、“过错”，所谓的“救赎”就是“赎罪”的过程。
  从回忆起优子开始火村便开始用一生去救赎，震后音羽市的重建也是兑现与优子的承诺。最后在迟了多年的圣诞夜上收到了优子送给自己的围巾，最终得到了救赎。
  在Eden中救赎则变成了一种羁绊，或者或Eden是一个赎罪的游戏。通过Sion来对夏目赎罪的少校；通过Sion来对自己的自己赎罪的亮；通过亮来对艾莉卡赎罪的Sion。
  当然在Minori的笔下，救赎的结果一定是悲剧，但是这也不能单纯地以悲剧来说明。
  以前曾经考虑过优子、Sion的结局是以虐为虐才诞生的结局。但是现在思考下，或许在Minori的眼里“救赎”必定伴随着“失去”，”拯救“并不是毫无条件的，正因如此才会显得更新珍惜。
  嗯，写得并不满意。要说的话现在心情就像以前看空之境界，俯瞰风景那时候。
  记得橙子有段话，记不清楚了。大意是，人站在高处，会有种向下跳的冲动。自己所生活的世界被一览无遗时所感受到冲动，从俯瞰的视界所带来的感觉——遥远。平淡的风景也会因为这视界而变得壮阔，但是过于广阔的视界却会变成与世界之间的隔阂。在这个广阔的视界下看到世界是自己所生活的世界的实感却怎么也无法得到。
  对于悠久之翼、Eden之类的美得震撼、窒息的GAL。比起去理解更近一步的感受到大概是绝望，因自身永远也无法到达的地方的绝望。
  以上吧。

24962185.review:
I'm not sure I how feel about eden,* but know the feeling wasn't "statisfied".   

The story is sort of tragic (it IS tragic) but it comes off as very predictable and the story itself constantly feeds and foreshadows its own tragic end.  Both of the lead characters are extremely practical emotionally, so when the characters in the story show such little emotion it can be hard to get drawn in.  The main character is so stoic he can only make progress emotionally by experiencing invasive plotlines that cause the reader to wonder if “fantasy” should be added as a tag.  I guess I was hoping for a struggle - seeing the heroines struggle to accept emotion instead of a switch just being turned.   
     
I was ready for “the end” well before the story gave it to me and the time between when I was ready and the game finally did end didn’t add anything for me personally.  This is the first VN I have completed and when I went to "gallary" at the end felt no draw whatever to recall any certain parts of the story.  Generally, I find it hard to ever uninstall a VN, just like it can be hard to sell a good book, but I don't see myself mssing this one :(.       

Pros?   it is an interesting setting and if you aren’t extremely cynical you will probably personalize parts of the story and get some emotional ripples out of it.  The story is essentially “bird-in-cage,” “stoic heroines,” & “Save yourself and leave me to my fate.”  The animation was good and the project very good quality. This is a truly beautiful story that will take about 15 hours to complete. It is also worth mentioning that it is a Kinetic novel.

It has beautiful music with great characters. Amazing art and a wonderful story. This is a game that I can recomend buying at full price, and is definitely worth purchasing when on sale.

24692203.review:
[h1] eden*-末世的爱情    [/h1] 
       花了20多个小时通关了这部galgame，感慨万千。感谢minori给我们带来了这么好的作品，不愧是当时处在巅峰时期的中二社做出来的作品，各方面都堪称是顶尖。
       剧情方面，整个游戏的剧情大致可分为两个部分，第一部分为Ryou和Lavie一起来到研究所成为Sion的侍卫，并由此认识了Sion、Elica等人，这部分以Ryou带着Sion逃离研究所结束。第二部分为Ryou与Sion两人在逃离研究所之后的隐居生活，期间穿插了年轻女记者Maya的来访。最后，整个故事以Sion去世，Ryou独自一人留在行将毁灭的地球上结束。整个剧本很好的衬托出了“They were only two, on the planet”这个主题。
       关于配乐，天门的配乐可谓恰到好处，尤其是几首小提琴曲很值得细细去品味。
       关于画面，那时首创的1024*640的分辨率现在看来效果仍不错，同时，多达199张的CG也显示出本作的精美。
玩完整部作品之后，也许就会发现，幸福原来是这么的简单，在Ryou与Sion的点点滴滴的日常事务中，幸福就那么一点一点的积累了起来，这种简单而纯粹的幸福无疑会让玩家感同身受，使得游戏有着更加强烈的代入感。
       总之，这部galgame当之无愧是一部很好的作品，以10分为满分的话，我会打9.5分，值得推荐给其他的玩家。
PS:虽然这部作品有18X的补丁，但我并不打算去玩，这样一部纯爱的作品我个人觉得还是不要18X会比较好。

24203549.review:
For God's sake, save your money. This was maybe the worst story I've ever experienced, in any medium. 

It should be, but isn't, broken up into two distinct episodes. The first half is a fairly decent, if cliche-riddled, suspense plot, and the second half feels like a too-long epilogue that eventually festers into 3-4 hours of syrupy, sentimental loli fetish scenes. In both halves, the story goes out of its way to deflate elements of narrative tension that it bothers to introduce, with antagonists literally just stepping out of the protagonists' way. 

The writing itself is verbose to the point of smothering the emotional impact that a scene might have. Characters will repeat a simple statement three or four times in the same scene, contributing to the problem of scenes that go on for 2-3x longer than they need to. There are many scenes that are repetitive or pointless (and still go on for 2-3x too long). Props, symbols, and images are repeated constantly, leaving them shopworn. Added for good measure is some cheap moralizing about taking care of the planet, the "appetites of those in power," and a few other super-deep subjects. Ryou even says "Sometimes, even pointless conversations can teach you a thing or two," without apparent irony.

Speaking of characters, they're more stock than Getty Images. For brevity, I'll talk mainly about the Gary Stu protagonist: He kills without a flicker of emotion, flies a helicopter, cooks breakfast (which he does over and over), and generally does anything the plot needs him to do with no previous setup. He can also completely abandon his professed love for violence and following orders, opting to dedicate his whole life to taking care of his loli. If this sounds like it could maybe be a character arc -- trust me, it isn't. His change is quick, complete, and virtually conflict-free. His old life doesn't come back to haunt him or lure him back to his past ways. I think there's one line, as he's serving his bedridden daughter figure dinner or something, where he mentions not liking how domestic he's become, but he doesn't actually experience any tension or conflict because of it -- he keeps it up, getting even more pathetic as he goes along. He also treats the female lead like an idiot, points his gun at everybody, and does some highly rapey stuff to a throwaway character who's introduced toward the back end of the story. Great guy.

So, what actually works in this game? The sounds effects, music, and voice acting are all fine to my ear. The art is nice, and really deserves a better story. I wouldn't mind this style becoming the norm for VNs. There's a warm glow to the scenery and lighting, and camera focus is used really well. The character designs are okay to good, and the blinking and moving mouths add to the immersion in a big way. But for whatever reason, characters tend to "dance" through three or four poses in a single conversation -- it can get a little distracting, like watching the exaggerated gestures and expressions of an actor in a silent film. Still, it's doesn't detract from the visuals too much, and some of the poses are cute.

There are many, many problems with this game -- more than I've mentioned here. I can't recall being more disappointed.

24139920.review: It's a touching visual novel with linear story. Great artwork, music and voice acting. The VN is quite long, but this in itself isn't a bad thing. The story makes ample use of flashbacks / flash forwards to show how past interactions of the various characters affect their future situations, and to gradually show how various factors add complexity to what first appeared to be simple events (e.g. the main character getting assigned to guard a "relaxed" research facility, despite his special forces background). Having said that, the pace does feel sluggish at times. The characters are interesting enough, and their eventual fates felt reasonably realistic given the circumstances. It's not really a "game" (due to its linear nature), but if you seek a long kinetic novel with good production values, IMHO this is a good buy.

24124890.review:
This VN is so boring. The plot is so sluggish. It's mostly fluff. I'd rather read so many other books. Why does this cost so much money??? I got it for like free in a bundle but I don't even want to waste my time finishing it. Every time the plot gets remotely cute and fun, it becomes dull and dry. Every time the plot gets dark and creepy, it becomes dull and dry. While the writing isn't awful, it lack brevity and doesn't tease enough interesting plot twists. All the characters are predictable and tropish in a bad way. I kept trying to force myself to read more, but it would never grab me.

It's not even that I don't like VNs. I've read a bunch before this, and while the art is incredible, it's just so boring  and slow! The protagonist is a robot of a human. All of the women coo at him from the moment they meet him, without any depth or hint or tease as to why. A lot of the story doesn't even make sense; [spoiler]Shion's laboratory doesn't screen out assassins. Even with this plothole, it had so much potential to be interesting, but the literally skim over the first murder and show a black screen for it because god forbid anything but kawaii eyes and fat tits be drawn.[/spoiler] Even though it is mostly fluff and purple prose, none of it makes me want to giggle or charms me. It's all plain. Either the characters seem dead and emotionless, or they are moody, snappy hot-heads. No one is relatable. Furthermore, there is nothing to contrast the whole sullen mood of the VN or give it a vibrant personality or a memorable character.

To be honest, I don't understand all the positive reviews for this title. While eden*'s art is probably the highest quality I've seen of any anime VN, the turtle-pace and dullness of the plot ruins it for me.

23953034.review:
minori's next work after [i]ef ~ a fairy tale of the two.[/i] draws upon a common trope -- the impeding end of the world, and crafts it to their trademark of visually-impressive stories with lots of tearjerking moments.

A red star signals the end of planet Earth, and humanity decided to produce genetically-engineed humans called felixes to help assist them in producing massive ships that will take them out of their beloved world that was facing certain doom. One of those felixes is Sion, the head of the project in charge of evacuating humanity. When battle-hardened soldier Ryou Haruna is assigned to guard Sion, the sad story truly begins.

minori's trademark high production values in a sea of visual novels still shine in [i]eden*[/i]; with lovely visuals, emotionally apropos music, and top-notch writing, even though it is quite short for a Japanese-made commercial VN -- it will take one no more than ten hours to get through the whole thing.

And what would've been better for [i]eden*[/i]? An English dub, to draw in a bigger audience. Because I have some experience with [i]ef[/i] -- especially the anime version -- I'm confident that I have chosen my ideal cast list, drawing from practically the same cast as [i]ef[/i], with one notable exception.

Ryou Haruna = Chris Patton (Sousuke Sagara in [i]Full Metal Panic![/i]; Kyousuke Tsutsumi in [i]ef[/i])
Sion = Hilary Haag (Yui in [i]Angel Beats![/i]; Mizuki Hayama in [i]ef[/i])
Elica = Carli Mosier (Yuiko Kurugaya in [i]Little Busters![/i]; Yuuko Amamiya in [i]ef[/i])
Lavinia F. Asai = Allison Keith (Melissa Mao in [i]Full Metal Panic![/i]; Nagi Hirono in [i]ef[/i])
Naoto Inaba = Josh Grelle (Armin Arlert in [i]Attack on Titan[/i]; Akira Amamiya in [i]ef[/i])
Natsume = Luci Christian (Nagisa Furukawa in [i]Clannad[/i]; Miyako Miyamura in [i]ef[/i])
Maya Touno = Tia Ballard (Happy in [i]Fairy Tail[/i]; Komari Kamikita in [i]Little Busters![/i])

So, thanks to minori and MangaGamer for bringing in a fine piece of work that will continue to inspire me to make more visual novels as a game developer.

23801649.review:
I like anime, but this is my first "visual novel." I made it all the way through this story, and I can't recommend it. The art is really good. The music is appropriate albeit a little repetitive. The story had some promise at first (it seemed), and had some novel ideas, but ended up just being cliché. As others have mentioned, the ending had the makings of being sad, but for me really wasn’t. Why? By the time they got around to ending it, I didn’t really care about any of the characters.

Writing was ok, but I can’t think of a scene except for the very last one that wasn’t unnecessarily drawn out way too long. I know they were trying to provide backstory and detail in an attempt to make the characters deeper, but for me there were far too many instances thinking “I wish they would just get on with it an advance the plot already…” Sometimes that wish would take as much as 30-45 minutes of drawn out dialog.

The characters themselves weren’t great. Sion was the character I liked the most, and her story was fairly sad. The male main character I didn’t care at all for. He was intentionally cold, emotionless, and flat. They tried to remedy that near the end of the story, but by then I just simply didn’t care. It was too little too late. A half an hour of opening him up at the end didn’t make up for 9.5 hours of listening to the same “poor me” lines from him again and again.

I was waiting for some action, or a big plot twist, or something. Nothing like that ever came. The story was extremely predictable from beginning to end. I'm glad that I was eventully able to reach the end, just because this is the first visual novel that I've ever experienced. It's an interesting idea, and I'm sure there are good ones out there, but I didn't think this one was particularly great. The whole story could have easily been condensed down to 2 hours and probably would have been more enjoyable, given the fact that at 10+ hours in, at the end, you wouldn't be feeling like the whole experience was such a chore.

At the end, for me the positives outweigh the negatives. I've read the positive reviews and I can see why some people liked it, but reading the negative reviews after having gone through this, I don't disagree with any of the points that they make either. 3/10.

23355162.review:
The premise is pretty solid for this one and I think the execution does it justice, though the game does lose a bit of momentum in its second half, and the last act of the game is kind of a slog similar to sitting through a funeral. But overall, I enjoyed it. The art is good, the music is good, the story's not too long, the characters, while maybe a bit mary sue-ish, feel real enough to keep me engaged in their interactions, and the ambiguous nature of the main plot is probably for the best; doesn't really need to be an exact answer for everything. The romantic aspects are generally sidelined and only come into play near the end (maybe why the ending felt like a slog for me) but there's enough of a buildup and character development that it's not really bothersome. Do note that this is a VN with no choices whatsoever, literally just a visual novel that you read/look at/listen to etc. But it works fine for the story. So yeah. Mildly pleasant overall, doesn't really feel like it drags on much, and there's plenty of heart to it.

The heck is up with the intro though, doesn't really fit in with the tone of the game at all.

23291744.review:
選択肢一切なしのビジュアルノベル。
日本語字幕はないが、日本語吹き替えありでフルボイスなので、話を理解する上では全く困らない。

素晴らしいゲームでした。
オートモードで約10時間というなかなかのボリュームですが、面白すぎて一気に最後まで読み進めてしまいました。

[h1]シナリオ面[/h1]
～あらすじ～
終末へ向かう世界。人類は滅び行く地球を捨て、新たな惑星へ脱出する計画を発動。
不老長寿の人工生命体「フェリクス」の高い知能により、ついに人類は地球脱出計画を完遂しようとしていた。
そんな折、フェリクスの中心人物である少女の元に、一人の青年が派遣されてきたところから、この物語は始まる。

といった具合に、背景には色々とSFチックなスケールの大きな話もあるが、はっきり言ってこれはさほど重要ではない。
この物語の中心にあるのは、あくまで「最期の時を外の世界で過ごしたい」と願う一人の少女と、
その少女のために、自身の全てを賭けた一人の青年の、純粋なラブストーリーである。

滅びを迎えようとしている世界で、寿命が尽きようとしている少女は何を想うのか。
その少女のために、「彼女たち」は何を行うのか。
そして、「彼」は何を願うのか。是非、最後まで見届けて下さい。

[h1]ビジュアル面[/h1]
立ち絵がほぼ存在せず、ほとんど全てをCG一枚絵で表現するというとんでもない手の込みよう。
しかも、そのCGが結構動く。CG総数はなんと驚愕の199枚！
その超美麗なグラフィックと、美しいBGMとの相乗効果でどんどん世界に引きずり込まれていく。声優さんもかなり豪華な布陣。

[h1]総評[/h1]
よっぽど読み物が嫌いな人でなければ、オススメできるゲームです。
絵がエロゲっぽい上、その手のパッチもあるようなので誤解されそうですが、
そういった描写からは縁遠い、ひたすらに美しく、純粋なラブストーリーです。
緩やかに訪れる終末を描く、という意味では、
同じくSteamで出ている「プラネタリアン」や「ナルキッソス」にも通じるものがある気がするので（あっちは恋愛要素ありませんが）
それらが好きだった人は間違いなくハマると思います。

23204107.review:
Relaxing. Innocent. Sad. Funny.

An excellent visual novel with an intrigung story and great characters.

Ryou, a soldier having worked for the military as part of an elite unit, is sent to protect Sion, the person responsible for saving humanity from Earth's imminent destruction.

There are no choices to be made in this game, so you can just turn on auto play and watch it like a regular anime if that is what you prefer.

The art and music is superb, and the voice actors and actresses are top-notch having worked on popular shows such as Naruto, Clannad, Gintama and many others.

I only experienced two minor cons. It felt like a few scenes dragged on for a split second too long, and some of the sound effects (such as when someone's stomach rumbles) sounded a bit strange.

Other than that everything was great, and I definitely recommend eden*.

Tip: If you want to play the game in "full screen" I recommend using the program Borderless Gaming. You can buy it on Steam or download it for free (legally) online.

In this case, it has a very good animation.

The "game" itself is pretty simple, I would say. You just appreciate the story. 
And, well, it has some nice story. The description of the game serves well to immerse yourself, first, into the world.
And anything more that I should say could be considered spoiler.

Still, I can only recommend it. If you don't still know what a visual novel, you may, as well, have some time with this one. But, remember, you'll only appreciate it if you can be pacient and read the dialogues and follow the story, because you won't interact with pretty much anything in here. If you do know what a visual novel is, this one is probably for you.

Although, I do think this is a bit expensive.

21971879.review:
This review is more of an emotional sight on the game, than rather pointing out the aspects of the game and it's mechanics etc.

[b] A love that even made it past the end of the world. [/b]

I think the first thing I want to mention about Eden* is that this is a once in a life time experience.
I have spent a lot of my time reading stories/books or whatever came under my eyes, but Eden* stood out from everything I have ever experienced.

I have to say that I'm still new to the Visual Novel genre and after I played two Sakura Games, I kinda thought that all the Visual Novels point out in a more "feminine sexy direction".
Even though that can be entertaining to a certain point, I was really glad to find out that this is not what all Visual Novels are about.

Since Eden* could be called a sci-fi genre I was kinda sceptical at first, since I enjoy the medival age over any futuristic genre, but I'm really glad I gave it a go, because I would have missed a masterpiece of art, graphics, voice acting, story, music and an emotional expirience. 
I'm still lacking words to actually point out how good it is, since it's way to spectacular to really put everything in a review or even on a thought itself.
I do wanna point out the music for itself as well. I still cannot really tell if the music is incredible sad or unbelievable beautiful. But it comforts the story and the dialogue so well that it's always on point. 
Even if you take out the music itself I could listen to Eden's* tunes everyday without playing the game just because it's so amazing, heart touching and it feels like opening up a gate into your very own imagination.

Even though I finished the story it feels like it never ended. I have played the second half of this game in one go because there was no way for me to stop in the middle of this beautiful story but afterwards I was kinda sad.
Sad that I've read it in one go. Sad that it actually ended. But on the other hand this is a story so perfect that even if the story is over, even if the world would end, it still continues.
And still I have the feeling that I want to experience this even further, even after the game has ended.

This story would not change if you read it a second time, but it wouldnt lose its power either. It is rare for me, that a story brings me down to tears, but that term would be way to less to describe the state this game left me in. I have never cried over a story for more than 3 hours STRAIGHT. Just because it was so beautiful and heart breaking in the same time. And I do know for myself that I will play this game over and over again, countless times and the fact that I cry would not change. I think it would be a shame not to cry at this brilliant story. It deserves to shed some tears.

If you have the time, the patience/concentration and the interest to experience a story beyond any expectations please give Eden* a chance.
I do wanna point out in the end that all the small details that may be just everyday things become a part of the big beautiful scenery, so it is worth to give everything a second look and thought.

With this I feel like I should come to an end even if I still got countless words that I want to say about this story, but after all, this story speaks louder than any voice/text or review could.

Thank you for taking the time to read my opinion about Eden* !
And for everyone out there, if you look for a story so perfect end emotional that it will for sure stay in your mind over a very long time get Eden* and have yourself that incredible experience.

Special THANKS to my good friend [url=http://steamcommunity.com/id/D4wnn]Dawn[/url] who recommended and bought me this.!

21862593.review:
Não é possível considerar essa história como um jogo, pois é apenas uma história animada onde você aperta o botão para prosseguir. Como uma história, vale a pena, pois é uma história bela e tocante, com um roteiro bastante original e interessante. 

Apesar de uma bela história romântica com vários momentos sutis e tocantes, infelizmente o personagem principal deixa um pouco a desejar, frequentemente estragando o clima de vários momentos bonitos, além de parecer que caiu de para-quedas e apenas deixou-se levar pelos acontecimentos. Outro ponto que fica claro é que alguns dos personagens secundários parecem mais carismáticos e interessantes que o casal principal. 

De qualquer forma, a experiência foi bastante satisfatória e eu ficarei feliz em encontrar histórias como essa no futuro, que valem o investimento de uma dúzia de horas, principalmente se você já estiver ficando velho como eu e mais afeito a histórias mais sutis e profundas.

21805911.review:
今天刚通关，眼框里面仍然存韵的泪水让我不得不顾来写篇感想。

柔顺飘逸的银白色长发，闪耀着红宝石般的光辉的双瞳，再加上雪白的皮肤以及娇小的身躯，诗音给人的印象就像是做工精细的洋娃娃一般的小巧可爱和弱不禁风，使人不禁怜爱地想要将她拥入怀中，却又担心这样会把柔弱的她弄坏。但是，就是在那样娇小的肩膀之上，却担负着与其极不相符的重担——作为为拯救人类而培育出来的3000名菲利克斯之一，拥有着世界上最为顶尖的头脑以及不老长寿的身体的她，扮演者实施地球脱出计划之中最为重要的角色。于是，她就像被软禁一般地呆在了处于孤岛之上的研究所里，为了拯救人类进行了将近一百年的研究。

但是，为拯救人类而奉献出自己的一生这样的事，就是诗音真正的愿望吗？就是诗音真正所期望的、真正想要去做的事吗？答案是否定的。

从小的时候开始，诗音便从未踏出研究所一步。正因为如此，诗音一直向往着外面的世界——广阔无边的大地，蔚蓝深邃的海洋，一望无际的天空，这一切的一切，都是诗音所憧憬着的东西。其中最好证明，便是诗音小时候发生过的那件事了。诞生之后的她，与其他的菲利克斯之间最大的不同，不在于她的外表，而在于她的行为。当其他的菲利克斯正在按照研究员的指示进行学习的时候，诗音总是喜欢站在窗前发着呆，看着窗户外面的景色。即使那片景色一直以来总是一成不变，她也不会感到丝毫的厌倦，总是呆在窗边遥望着。甚至，她因此还差点被研究员视为“不良品”而“处理”掉。可见，她是多么得向往外面的世界，多么得渴望自由，多么得期望在外面的世界里生活啊！但是，即使是这么简单的心愿，也是不可能会被允许的。因为对人类而言，这样的愿望与全人类的存亡相比，只不过是一件“微不足道”的小事而已。于是，作为菲利克斯的“使命”以及孤岛上的研究所分别化作了精神与身体上的牢笼，把渴望自由，向往天空，想要翱翔于天际的小鸟，牢牢地锁在了笼中……

但是，尽管身处“牢笼”之中，“小鸟”却一刻也未曾停止过自己对于“天空”的向往。并且，与此同时地，诗音倾尽着自己的全力进行着研究，引领着全人类继续实施地球脱出计划，并顺利地进行到了最后的阶段。诗音，压抑着自己的愿望，终于完成了自己的使命。只是，此时此刻的她的身体状况，已然一日不如一日，支撑着她，让她想要继续活下去的支柱，除了一直陪在她身边的艾莉卡之外，或许，就只剩下对外面的世界的向往而已。然而值得庆幸的是，诗音的这个小小的愿望，最终得到了回应。至于个中缘由，有可能是命运对于她拯救了人类的奖赏，也可能是命运对于她那即将消逝的生命的怜悯，更可能这只是命运的进行发生了难得一见的偏差的结果，总之，在身边的人的帮助之下，诗音跟着亮逃出了“牢笼”，终于来到了向往已久的外面的世界，终于，“小鸟”翱翔在了蓝天之下。

靠着特种部队出身的亮的经验和技术，摆脱了军队的追捕的亮和诗音来到了亮小时候生活的故乡，开始了他们新的生活。而对于这来之不易的东西，两人也是格外地珍惜。只是，此时两人的关系又是怎样的呢？在我看来，两人当时的羁绊，或许比“朋友”这种关系还要来得淡薄。因为，对于刚在一起生活的两人来说，彼此的存在只不过是各自的心里面重要之人的替代品而已——作为诗音逃出研究所的代价，像姐姐一般照顾着自己、一直陪在自己身边的艾莉卡失去了生命，于是，诗音把代替艾莉卡跟在自己身边的亮当作了艾莉卡的替代品；作为亮小时候没能保护好自己的“姐姐”夏目的代价，亮永远地失去了自己的“姐姐”，于是，亮也把代替“姐姐”和自己一起生活的诗音当作了替代品。互相把对方当成替代品，互相支撑着对方生活下去，不重要的同时却又是最为重要的存在，这，就是当时两人之间的关系。

不过，也正如我上述所言，两人之间的那种关系也只不过是“当时的关系”而已。正如世界上不可能存在一成不变的事物一样，亮和诗音之间的羁绊也随着时间的流逝而朝着积极的方向发生着变化。生活在同一屋檐下，朝夕相处，再加上除了睡觉的时间之外两人基本上都会呆在一起，所以，彼此对于对方的了解不断地加深着，两人之间羁绊也随之越发深厚和牢固。于是，在亮和诗音还没有意识到的时候，渐渐的，两人不再把对方当成自己重要之人的替代品，而是把对方看作是彼此最为重要的存在，彼此珍视着彼此。不过，这种模糊不清的暧昧关系，最终还是被一个契机给打破了。

随着时间的流逝，世界正在以看不见的微妙变化走向着灭亡，而通往宇宙的“诺亚方舟”，也只剩下最后一个航班了。因为真夜的到来而意识到不能因为自己的原因而让亮留在地球上的诗音，为了不让自己最重要的人因为自己的关系而死去，毅然选择了让亮陪同真夜踏上搭乘最后一班的宇宙飞船，选择了让自己独自一人呆在地球上，直到死去。不过，尽管亮答应了下来，但其内心此时却是烦恼不已——“尽管这是诗音的意志，但是这样真的好吗？留下诗音，留下孤独一人的诗音，这样的结果，我真的可以接受吗？”其实，这样子扪心自问的亮的心里面早就有了答案，会这样犹豫不决只是因为没有看见自己心中对诗音感情，没有发现能够让自己留下来的理由而已。好在就要离开的前一天晚上，无意间梦见了艾莉卡的亮最终发觉了自己对诗音的感情，毅然决然地选择了留下来，选择了呆在诗音的身边，直到永远。从此，互相察觉到了自己的心意的两人，互相感受到了彼此的心意的两人，终于重新认识到了对方在自己心目中的地位，终于，在彼此之间建立起了比以往都要深厚和坚不可摧的羁绊！

只可惜，天下没有不散的筵席。人在他出生的那一刻起，便注定了他必将会有死亡的一天，也就注定了他与别人的分别。所以，分别必然的，所不同的，也就只有分别的时间而已。

在亲眼目睹了自己研制的飞船顺利升空之后，感到安心了的诗音，其身体状况愈发地一日不如一日，陷入沉睡的时间越来越多，醒来的时间越来越少，即使偶尔醒过来，诗音的身体也是非常的虚弱。而这些现象，也正是菲利克斯即将逝去的象征。明白这一切的亮尽管焦急不已，尽管心里面悲痛万分，可是他却从不会在诗音面前表露出来。因为他明白，让诗音知道自己的悲痛除了会让她感到内疚和伤心之外，什么也不会改变。所以，为了在那为数不多的日子能够让诗音保持那份微笑，亮隐藏起了自己的悲伤……然后，在某天，久违地醒了过来的诗音在亮的搀扶之下，来到岩石边上坐下的两人，在目睹了夕阳西下这美丽而又悲伤地景色之后，诗音，永远地闭上了眼睛……

于是，两个人的伊甸园从此只剩下了一个人，世界上最后的爱情物语也就此画上了休止符。只是，亲手埋葬了诗音的亮的生活依旧持续着，孤独一人地，直到世界的终结……
