To be honest, this is the first VN i've read, and probably'll be one of that stucks in my mind. I'll just give a quick review based on my first time

Story: The story builds around bittersweet theme. It has some heartwarming friendship and romance, with an unavoidable doom that waits in the end of the story. While the story lacks world building and near-end events (which bugs me a little), that doesn't really change how good the story actually is. 

Character: one of the thing that surprises me is that the character and their development is pretty good. even the supportive character has their own interesting backstory. 

Visual: stunning and beautiful visual? i'd say it's hard to believe this VN is actually 5 years old.

Music: as expected from Tenmon, his soundtrack never fails to amuse me. The amazing soundtracks plays well with the story, strengthen the feelings gained from reading the story.

Ending: for the ones that finished reading eden*, admit it. you saw it coming from miles away, but still, it kicked you pretty hard. The ending is just plain sad, but at a same time, it's kinda heartwarming.

if you're going to buy this VN, trust me, you're not going to regret spending around 10 bucks for this. 9/10

14603699.review:
I knew it was coming, I thought I was prepared, but I still cried at the end. 

It makes me wonder, is there such a thing called "being fully prepared?" To what extent justifies that a person is fully prepared? Or does a person even have to be fully prepared to face problems at all... eden* did a really wonderful answering each question I've thrown up. 

I've have to say that the number of VNs I've read can be counted with my fingers alone, but in any case, any good work would deliver perhaps more so to people that still sees something as fresh.

I really liked the style the story presented itself. The players would already know what is going to happen in the end from just the title and the first few minutes of the game. A style that is rarely used but makes what happened at the beginning crystal clear by the end. A story that connected each character it has ever shown to have a significant impact which was truly amazing on how everything can be seen as these keys that slowly but truly opens the door to that one path. 

The story (not giving a synopsis) is a simple one that means that character devolopments is key here. The way eden handled each relationships from family, friends, to even lovers were spendidly done. The lingering thoughts about someone important (aka flashbacks) really just shows the sentimental feeling and happiness from past events.

The art was stunningly beautiful especially with the scenes showing nature in its full glory. The OST (offical soundtrack) manages to further cultivate the already existing emotions formed by the art, story and words. Making each emotion and scene that much more powerful, which made it truly mesmerizing as the story reaches its envitable climax. 

I never was much of a person to use the word "melodramatic" (as I love drama), this VN though was a great feels ride that leaves this sense of satisfaction at the end to the point that there was no need to further tie any loose ends. Focusing on the important stuff with a fair pace, that is what truly matters afterall.

【诗　音】 
「如果，能再一次醒来的话……」 
【诗　音】 
「两人……一起……」 

言语……中断了。 
随之，她的嘴唇再也没有动。 
脑袋靠着我的肩膀，闭上了眼睛， 
嘴角仅仅浮出笑容。 
搂着她的肩膀，我也一动不动。 
想永远拥抱着进入永眠的她。 
这样就好。 
我想，这样就好。 
在她进入最后的休眠的时刻，我就在她身边。 
就算艾莉卡不在她身边，她也并非独自一人。 
她一定不会寂寞的吧。 
这种微笑，就是证明。 
而且，也是我在这里的理由。 
我一直在向往，寻求，拜托的答案，现在就存于此处。 
所以，我只能说出一句话一一 
只用一句话，告诉她。 

「晚安，诗音一一」

14526154.review:
This Visual Novel... is a masterpiece... I have to say it is 100% one of my very favorite VNs. The ride of feelings and emotions you go through as you begin to understand the characters and care for them in your own way. Most other VNs I've gone through barely scratch the surface on emotions... and I can't say many things bring me to tears, but this VN accomplished that. I do hate one thing about it though... that I can't play it for the first time again.

Trying to not spoil anything is very hard, as I want to just write all about it in this review, but I will restrain myself, of course. You MUST experience this, it is well worth the $20. It should be worth $40 in my opinion. 

The soundtrack is wonderful, I find myself listening to some of the tracks back to back just because they are so awesome to listen to. The voice acting is incredible, the voices fit the characters nicely and not to mention, they animated the lips/mouths while they speak, which is rare.

Be ready for the roller coaster of emotions... including rage, hate, the want for revenge, happiness, sadness and most of all, the Love that 2 people can share that could overcome anything. Seriously... I can't get anymore detailed without giving some plot away... Do not pass up this story, it would be a shame for you to miss it.

Edit: I also don't write reviews on most anything, the fact that I took the time to do so for this VN should say something!

14512013.review:
[h1]Likes:[/h1]
[b]O[/b] Superb characters development and interaction.
[b]O[/b] Simple, slightly slow paced, but very touching tale with melancholy yet heart-warming conclusion.
[b]O[/b] Excellent voice acting. The main protagonist, which is a point of view character, is also fully voiced.
[b]O[/b] Above average cinematography when compared with other traditional visual novels.

[h1]Dislikes:[/h1]
[b]X[/b] Strange display aspect ratio (16:10) with relatively low resolution. Note that the original Japanese version was released in 2009.
[b]X[/b] The plot is quite predictable.

[h1]Remarks:[/h1]
[b]-[/b] This is a kinetic novel, i.e. a visual novel with no branching plot, with approximately 10 hours reading time. Thus, gameplay and replayability are nonexistence here.
[b]-[/b] This is also not a sci-fi oriented, but a simple yet touching love story. Don't let the description on Steam Store misleads you.
[b]-[/b] Avoid this like plague if you hate sad story.

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
One of the most touching and heartbreaking story I have ever read. This is easily one of the best visual novel currently available on Steam.

[spoiler]Sweet dreams, Sion.[/spoiler]

An increedible title in nearly every regard. I would compare the story and characters to a printed novel any day. Around 9-10 hours long at a decent reading speed, there is plenty of time to become invested in several of the characters and undersnd why they do what they do. This is one of the most emotional and riveting stories I've seen in a long time. The ending had me feeling happiness, sadness, loneliness and many other emotions. [spoiler]Tears were shed.[/spoiler]

The music ranges from relaxing to somber to energetic and every piece enhances the mood of the story. The art is so beautifully done that even looking at some of the same pieces again and again, it never gets tiring.

My only real complaint with [i]Eden*[/i] is during some scenes the character's face looks out of proportion. I only noticed it on Sion, but I saw it at several different parts. Also the menu in the bottom right isn't very smooth, but that's a very minor flaw in my eyes.

14476375.review:
This is a visual novel that can be played automatically and does not need the viewer's input to decide the story.  In fact, this is just a story, and it's a damn good one too.

Like holy.... I just finished this entire series after 8 hours and I feel like my heart's been ripped out.  Ok, maybe not that severe, but I thought the story was overall extremely cute.  A very well done visual novel, and I will not spoil anything in the story since that's what you're going to be paying for if you choose to buy this, but in my opinion the story was....

The story was moderately boring in the beginning, but that's like all animes and visual novel stories because they need  to take a little time to establish the general context of the story, especially since this one starts off somewhere in the middle of someone's life.  So they reflect on the past for a little bit in the beginning, then move on towards the future while working in the present.  Anyways, I didn't feel like any part of the story dragged on for too long, except the end, but that's to be expected since well... you'll know why when you get eden*.  

Overall, 9/10.  If I had to judge this really harshly like my friends do.... I'm guessing they'd say 7-8.5/10 (which is super generous since they normally rate things at 5/10).  I'd still give it a 9/10, maybe even 10/10 since I don't normally watch from a large variety of anime or visual novels.  Worth the money, I got it when it was on sale for $10, but i'd say it would be worth the $20 too. 

Remember guys, you can watch/read this with your girl, and they'll appreciate it too (possibly more than you like mine).  :D

14397576.review:
What a great visual novel!
This was the second visual novel I actually finished from beginning to end (the first being Flyable Heart) and it was worth every minute. The story has so many feels and the characters are great, with just enough thought put into them to make you care about each one. As for the artwork, the backgrounds were breathtaking at times, and the character sprites, although limited, were also beautiful. One of the best aspects of this game though was the background music, and how it complemented the story perfectly.

Overall an amazing visual novel. Great for those looking to get into visual novels as it has a relatively short story (it took me about 8 hours to read it all) and it does not have choices. The lack of choices might equate to a lack of replay value, but the fact that I don't have to go back and reread a large chunk of the story multiple times in order to get the ENTIRE story is something that I enjoy.

Buy this game if you are looking to get a good taste of visual novels. Also, the funds collected from this game are going directly to the translation of the next game by this company.

14394098.review:
eden is a visual novel, and it is a good one. A few things set this apart from the others on Steam, and these are it: 
1. Unique artwork
2. A pleasant, interesting soundtrack
3. There's a long story, here. Most visual novels on Steam are very short. 
4. A great, easy to read translation. 
There's not a lot of negatives to this in comparison with other visual novels on Steam. If anything, it's a good place to start if you're looking for a good story and you enjoy reading. There are always certain things that are apparent in all visual novels, and that's not a bad thing. Recommended.

14388395.review:
This game's already been well reviewed, but I guess I'll toss in my two cents.

Short version: Cute, Tense (at points), Intruiging and Heartbreaking 

Long version: I really rather like eden*. The visual style, music and (though simple) animation are all really nice and fitting for the scenes and characters that they are part of. I love bittersweet stories as is and this one is really rather beautiful, although the first part dragged a little for me (the game takes ~2 hours to get to the opening cinematic - not kidding). Still interesting, though, and the first part does set up the story and characters nicely.

Dunno about £15, but the game is worth owning if you're a fan of this kind of thing (I bought it on the opening sale).

P.S. This Visual Novel has no choices to speak of or alternate routes, so replay value (in terms of alternate content - I'm okay with just replaying the same thing if it's good) is a bit limited. Take that as you will - I still got 10 hours out of the story, so I don't have a problem, but others might.

14319405.review:
I wasn't entirely sure about a VN priced at $20.00, but after about ten minutes in, I realized why. It should be noted that I'm fairly new to VN games in general, having only played six or seven personally. That being said, compared to those, this blows them out of the water. 

First off, the story is not only moving and impactful, but long. You don't actuall come across the intro until about 30~ minutes in. That's just a estimate, but it honestly felt the opening came in where other VN closing credits would start rolling.

Secondly, the entire VN is voice acted. Voice acted tremendously well, for that matter. Even the main protagonist has not only a voice, but a face as well.

Not only that, but the art in this game is amazing. At first I thought I was delusional, but every character's eyes and mouths move. Every character and background scene really immerse you into the story the developer wanted to portray. 

10/10, only regret regarding this game is the fact that I didn't buy it sooner.

14316631.review:
I don't have alot of experience with visual novels but enjoyed eden*.  I found the Story to be decent despite some lingering questions.  Spelling mistakes in the english dialogue were pretty minimal and easily ignored.  I didn't have difficulty understanding it for the most part.  

The Artwork was great although I found male characters to be sloppy compared to female characters.  There were nice touches like blinking eyes and moving mouths.  The mouths unfortunately don't always move during speech and while playing the visual novel in windowed mode the mouth was somewhat unnoticeable for me at times.  

The Sound was good throughout although you will hear certain tracks (if not all of them) over and over again which can become annoying but the music is good and the voicework while it was abit irritating at a certain point early on it was for the most part solid.

There really isn't any Gameplay but atleast I could save where I was and continue it later at anytime.  The most you can control aside from that is the flow of the story, window or fullscreen resolution and voicework.  If you just want to sit back and enjoy a story eden* will accomplish that.  If you're more interested in a game where you can be more stimulated this isn't it.

地球が終末へ近づいて居る事がわかり、紆余曲折の末、全人類地球脱出を目指し、それを達成しつつある未来。主人公、榛名亮統一軍准尉は孤島の研究所へ配属される……。

音声を聞きながらであれば10時間か9時間程度で完全攻略可能。作中で選択肢は一切ない、正しくデジタル紙芝居であるが、良い物語である事は保証する。僕は泣いた。

近未来の地球を舞台にしたSFなビジュアルノベルだが猥雑はない。
元々のパッケージ版も同じだが、当時同時発売されたeden* PLUS + MOSAICをインストールすることで本編とは別枠のえっちな場面(半分夢オチ)や本編に出血欠損裸体描写等を追加する事が出来た。

Steam版ではシナリオが背景の文字に至るまで丁寧に英訳されてあり、日本語音声はあるが、日本語字幕はない為、音声のない独白場面や情景描写が理解し難いかも知れない。また、パッケージ版とはファイル構成も実行ファイル自体も異なるので、パッケージ版eden* PLUS + MOSAICの適用は恐らく不可能である。

ただし、Steam版とは別に、パブリッシャであるMangaGamerが英語版eden* PLUS + MOSAICを自社サイトでダウンロード販売して居るので、こちらはもしかしたらSteam版にも適用できるかもしれない。MangaGamerではモザイク無しの製品を扱つてる為か日本からのアクセスを遮断してるので詳細未確認。

14288610.review:
So I bought this game on the mangagamer website. I played it trough but of course Steam wouldn't know about it hence my lack of playtime on my profile.

For those who aren't into Visual Novels:

I'm just gonna go ahead and say if you are a gamer in the sense that you wanna "play" with games this game is not for you. Visual Novel are about storytelling (or they should be) so most of the time you just advance the test.
This particular Visual Novel is a Kinetic Novel meaning you literally can't do anything during the gameplay. It's like an animated picture book with (japanese) voice acting and background music.

Among Visual Novels this is one of the best I've ever read so if you feel you might be intrested in a good, heartwarming and bittersweetstory then you have my recommendation. This is one of the finest examples of what Visual Novels can be at their best.


For those who already fans of the Visual Novel genre:

This is not a nukige. If you just wanna buy it because "lol it has a lol" then shame on you!
It's a feel-heavy storytelling piece which really deserves it's price. If you will buy just one VN in your entire life then put this game on the candidate list ASAP.
As to which version to buy. I have the PLUS+ MOSAIC from the Mangagamer site and after reading trough the game I cannot in good conscience go to the adult content.  Belive me you wouldn't miss anything with the Steam version.

It's important to note that adult content was in fact not censored away from this version but THIS is the original version of the game. The PLUS+ MOSAIC were originally a DLC and it can't be patched into the Steam version but again this game is more than perfectly fine without it. (In fact it would have ruined the mood for me at the end so IMHO it's better this way)

14278184.review:
Eden* ist ein Visual Novel mit animierten Grafiken, sprich: Die Figuren können blinzeln sowie sprechen. Die Story ist gut gemacht. In naher Zukunft, erscheint plötzlich ein roter Stern am Himmel, welcher die Vernichtung über allen Lebens auf der Erde bringen wird. Die vereinigte Regierung schlägt ein Evakuierung Projekt vor um die gesamte Menschheit in den Weltraum zu bringen. Für dieses Projekt wurden die sogenannten "Felixe" erschaffen. Entwickelt um hochintelligent, mit ewiger Jugend und Langlebigkeit gesegnet zu sein, stellen die gentechnisch veränderten menschlichen Felixe die einzige Hoffnung für das Überleben der Menschheit dar. Die begabteste der Felixe wird auf einer einsamen Insel gehalten, denn ihr einziger Zweck ist die Rettung der gesamten Menschheit. Ryou Haruna, ein Soldat wird gesendet um diese Felix zu bewachen, die verzweifelt nach Freiheit vom dem Militär sucht, welche sie auf dieser Insel gefangen hält. Die letzte Liebesgeschichte der Erde ist dabei zu beginnen.

Pro
- Tolle Animation
- Gute Story
- Atemberaubende Musik
- Interessante Charaktere
- Vocals für alle Charaktere sowie dem Protagonist

Contra
- Dialog-Spiel

Fazit:
Es ist mehr eine Geschichte als ein Spiel. Und doch hat es mir sehr gut gefallen.

Punkte
- Story 8,2/10
- Charaktere 7,8/10
- Grafik 9,0/10
- Gameplay 5,0/10
- Musik 9,4/10

Ergebnis: 7,88/10

14277931.review: This is a really well-made visual novel. The music score is great, the CG images are gorgeous, and the story is beautiful.

14277224.review:
A well illustrated visual novel, with a moving, although somewhat empty story. Set in the future, the earth is facing its destruction due to causes left largely unexplained. The protagonist Ryou is sent to guard a secret facility. The facility was used to research a new genetically modified form of human with hyper intelligence. These modified 'felixes' were used to research and design the ships to be used to escape the destruction of the planet. The story is told half through flashback about the events surrounding Ryou, and the final days of the doomed planet.

Ultimately however the story comes off as somewhat unsatisfactory. Due partially to its nature as a kenetic visual novel. There are no choices, and no options for further reading. The game presents a lot of interesting material, but it is entirely set within either the research facility or the countryside. There is little to no opportunity to learn about the rest of the world. Ultimately this is a love story between the hero and heroine, and the rest takes a backseat with no chance to bring to light anything about the interesting background world. If you like a romance, this is a very good one. But it falls quite flat in other areas. Particularly as the story is actually at its core very simple and straightforward, it could take place in any setting with minor modifications. It therefore doesn't make the best use of the world nor characters it has come up with.

Pros:

- Overall well illustrated, pleasing on the eyes.
- Mostly realistic, likeable characters. No airheads or stupidity here.
- Decent length; my playtime is slightly inflated, it should take around 6-8 hours to complete.

Cons:

- Character illustrations ocassionally off model.
- Very limited animation, some lip-flap and blinking is the extent of animation.
- Kenetic story means no opportunity to explore areas of personal interest.

14266875.review:
eden* is a Kinetic Visual Novel originally released in 2009 by minori (>inb4 minori is kinda paranoid back then that they sue someone and put region lock protection lel) that tells the story of a skilled soldier named Haruna Ryō and a felix girl named Sion.

The premise of the story is that in the far future, a huge mass energy called “Planet of Destruction” suddenly appeares in the sky as a red star. Lots of scientists starting to predict the end of the Earth, but at this point, 100 years before its predicted end, humankind started to feel another big threat - the Earth is dying: terrorist attacks and wars are ravaging badly that it decreased the human population rapidly. After some time passes, a United World Government was formed to prevent any further human destruction. When all the fighting stopped, the remaining humans came up with a plan to escape the Earth. At the same time, people were working on the “Felix Plan”: a plan to create a new technology to bring the remaining humans to a new planet. The story of Eden* begins 99 years later, when the Earth is on the brink of destruction.

Most of the stories were told via flashback and when you start the game for the first time, you could actually tell the ending since this is a kinetic VN. The flashback serves as to what is going on prior to the ending of the game and mostly consist of your SoL of Ryō & Sion.

The CG and BGM in this game was well done despite its age. The CG has that cold but warm hue to it that kinda adds melancholic feeling to the atmosphere, fitting the setting of what is going on around. I just wished that they did it on a higher resolution as most of the background CG is very calming, lushful and beautiful. The BGM is very well done, with based Tenmon also composing the BGM really gives that special feeling to it that somehow very calming yet at times is paced properly to what is going on around it.

I played the game for the first time on late 2010 and I fell in love with it. It is short & touching yet even though the opening of the game kinda spoiled you the inevitable ending, you still want to stick with it and enjoy the whole story and then cries on in the end :")

I recommend this VN if you enjoy planetarian and narcissu, it is on the same group cluster of short-but-packed feeling to it. This Steam version of eden* is the All-Age version, you can download the MOSAIC patch from your favorite site and inject it here or get it off MangaGamer store. Also the seiyuu of Haruna Ryō is Toru from Hitsugi no Chaika so if you're kinda pissed of at the ending of Chaika, go buy this, it'll help you get moar Tooooooru satisfication :^)

14251940.review:
This was my first visual novel, and I'm really glad it was!  It was a great way to jump into the visual novel genre.  As a kinetic novel, you play through the game like reading a book, with no options for the player to make choices to influence the storyline.  

But just because the playstyle was hands-off, it didn't lack in other departments.  The graphics are so beautiful - I am really drawn to games that are visually striking, where the art style is detailed and high quality.  This game is definitely gorgeous to look at, which is a major plus because I played the game for close to 20 hours.  

Another thing I really liked is how the characters aren't static.  On any particular scene, the characters' eyes blink, giving the "page" a little extra visual oomph.  The scenes also change slightly every few sentences, making it seem like the characters are moving - a tilt of the head, a turn of the body, movement of the arms - they all add up to make the characters appear fluid when they are actually standing still for most of the game.

The storyline is a little more militaristic than I expected, but still enjoyable.  Warning!  This novel is a tearjerker!  There are several character deaths, which was very difficult for me to get through. I loved their personalities and backstories, and it was heartbreaking to watch them die.  

Despite the sad parts, I would absolutely play this game again.  The artistry is magnificent, and the characters are intriguing and lovable.  Highly recommended!

Here is a link of my entire gameplay with commentary.

https://www.youtube.com/user/HiddenLevelStart

39238768.review:
eden* was my first choiceless visual novel I've played and it did a great job. 8/10

The story kept me hooked from beginning to end. I'm not usually a fan of heavy military story lines so I was a bit worried but the military setting is rather light and mixes into the main interests of the story seamlesly. 

Artwork for the game is absolutly brillant, you can see a lot of work and love went into it. I loved the slight eye and mouth animations.

The soundtrack is pretty nice. I feel like I didn't fall in love with any of the tracks during my playthrough but I was interested enough to go back and listen to it on YouTube. After having done so, I have found several tracks that I'm actually going to save for later listening.

VA is fantastic! All spoken dialog in the game is voice acted. You also have the option to turn off characters that you don't like. However I doubt you will actually hate any of the voices.

The UI was a bit confusing at first. I couldn't find the option to save until I accidently moved my mouse to the bottom right of the screen. It keep my eyes on the art and I wasn't distracted but some mention of the location before starting the game would of been nice.

Now I got eden* in a Humble Bundle for $10. I don't think i'd recommend this VN for $20. However if you are interested, there is a demo so you can try before you buy. There's also a 18+ version that you can find online. It adds some nudity and a lot of blood but I don't really feel it's needed.

All in all, eden* was a great experience! I had to hold back tears during the final act but I don't think it was enough for me to rate it higher then an 8.

39182233.review:
I've been putting off this visual novel for so long, but I'm glad I finally took the chance to sit through it.

Eden* is a short visual novel that tells the love story of the last two people on Earth in an era where the planet is inching towards its death. Although it's a love story, it certainly did not feel that way for the majority of the time I was reading it. It did not feel like the usual cute and cheesy love story that we've been accustomed to in anime culture. It felt like a lot of things, and I'm happy it did. Because the situation presented in its storyline was one that calls for a lot of emotions.

I'll refrain from commenting too much on the storyline. Instead, I'll focus on what it made me feel. What I felt throughout most of the visual novel was a tinge of loneliness. Almost everything past a certain point in the story had made me feel lonely, and even more aware of how separated we all truly are as people. However, loneliness is far from what the visual novel imparts to you by the end.

I'd encourage anyone with spare time to give the game a try. It has a unique concept of using rather theatrical methods in portraying the story at hand, and I believe it worked as well as intended. It was a new experience with how they structured the visuals, and I'd love to experience something like this again. The music was pretty good as well, matching the atmosphere and its transitions. I also liked how the characters developed as the story progressed, and how grounded in reality their process of decision-making was. 

For those who'll be asking about the adult version, there's not much of a difference, really. The adult version has the 18+ scenes in a separate option in the main menu, which you'll be able to access after you finish the main storyline. I'm glad they made these scenes as a sort of what-if scenarios, because I'm pretty sure they'd ruin the solemnity of the storyline if they were inserted somewhere in the middle, especially the scenes of the other main girls which I'm sure were made as a sort of bonus for the fans. In the end, the most important aspect of the visual novel is already included in the Steam all-ages version, so don't hesitate to pick it up. c:

I'm looking forward to more visual novels from minori and mangagamer being on Steam. <3

39164563.review:
Primeiramente quero dizer que estou começando a jogar VNs (esse é o meu segundo).

O foco desse jogo claramente é a história. Ela é completamente linear - ou seja, não há nenhuma escolha envolvida. A única interação que você tem com a história é clicar pra passar as falas. Pessoalmente, isso contraria o meu conceito de 'jogo', mas tudo bem. 
Fiquei impressionado por ele ter abertura, encerramento e dublagem dignos de animes. Bom, talvez muitos tenham isso, já que esse é apenas o meu segundo VN.

Visualmente, o jogo é muito bom. Personagens bonitos e cenários muito bem ilustrados, porém às vezes algumas expressões faciais ficaram bem esquisitas.

Tecnicamente, ele é ruim, já que ele opera em uma resolução de tela bem baixa, e em tela cheia ele simplesmente estica a imagem e aplica filtro bilinear, tornando um pouco mais amarga a experiência de jogar ele em uma resolução de tela um pouco mais alta. É de se esperar de um jogo de 2009, da época dos DVD-ROMs. 

A história não é ruim. Fiz questão de acompanhá-la um pouco mais lentamente que o meu normal. Em alguns momentos eu me senti levemente envolvido com ela, mas na maior parte do tempo eu achei ela fraca. Ela não conseguiu me prender. 
Bom, talvez eu seja tão ranzinza a ponto de perder o gosto por esse tipo de história. Mas logo vejo que não é o caso, porque meu gênero favorito de animes é o de romances. Boas histórias conseguiram me prender e me fazer me importar com os personagens, a ponto de ficar literalmente na bad quando algo de ruim acontece.
Mas esse jogo não despertou nada disso em mim. Ela não é tão boa quanto eu esperava.

No mais, esse jogo foi uma ótima aula de inglês, pois aprendi um monte de palavras e expressões mais complexas que eu não conhecia.

Enfim, queria dizer que esse jogo está longe de ser ruim e que notei o carinho que os desenvolvedores colocaram no projeto, mas pessoalmente acredito que ele não vale os R$ 36,99 que ele cobra. Existem muitos jogos que custam menos que isso e entregam um conteúdo mais substancial, e, como não tenho muita grana pra gastar, senti que poderia ter investido melhor esse dinheiro.

39152433.review:
“终于，世界只剩下我们两个人了呢”
      这是一个发生在世界即将迎来终焉时的故事。
      “很安静，在即将毁灭了的世界……我试着第一次也是最后一次的恋爱”
       这是一个关于名为榛名亮的少年和名为诗音的少女在地球最后的恋爱故事。
       说是少女其实有些不合适，作为菲尼克斯诗音已经走过了长达百年的岁月，而诗音真正作为“人”意义而言的生活，则是从亮带着她从研究所里逃离出来回到亮的故乡生活才开始的。在她最后的短暂生命当中，在世界即将迎来终焉的终末时刻，诗音得到了许多第一次的体验，她和亮的关系也在逐渐的变化着。开始，对诗音而言，亮也许只是艾莉卡的替代品，负责照顾她，保护她；对亮而言，照顾和保护诗音也许只是他对夏目的一种赎罪方式。但是在两人相处的过程中，一种过去所不曾拥有的，新的感情逐渐萌生。诗音从起初只是有些任性的希望最后亮能一直照顾自己直到最后，开始希望亮能活下去，到最后还是舍不得亮的离开。而亮也从一开始把照顾和保护诗音作为自己最后的任务和使命，到最后终于意识到陪伴在诗音身边不是什么使命抑或赎罪，而是自己发自内心的真诚希望。
       “这里一定是我们的乐园——”
       “是啊，这里是这颗行星上最后的乐园”
       其实从诗音开始在亮的面前流露出少女的一面时，我就在开始想象二人最后互诉心意的场景。没有轰轰烈烈，因为这已经是在世界末日了，也没有太过煽情，因为这已经是地球上最后的两个人了，和我预先的一样，两人坐在湖边，面向夕阳，诗音虚弱的身体依靠在亮的肩上，慢慢地闭上双眼。两人的接吻就是如此自然，缺也让人觉得如此悲伤无力。努力过了，也一直同命运抗争着，但是结果无论如何也无法改变，唯一所能做到的，就是在临走前创造更过的回忆。
       “煎鸡蛋，做不出来了……对不起……”
       “一直惯着我的任性……对不起……”
       “不能陪伴你到最后……对不起……”
       每次听到这种颤抖的声音，就觉得内心有什么东西在崩溃。
       “可以了……可以了……诗音……”
       还没有说完最后的话，诗音的生命之光就完全湮灭了，但是在这最后的乐园里，在诗音生命的最后时刻，有亮陪着，在遥远的那个地方，有艾莉卡等待着，诗音也不会感到寂寞了吧。
       “晚安，诗音——”

39127989.review:
Hi everyone, here I will give my five cents about the [strike]game[/strike], I mean visual novel. First of all, it's worth stating that this is a  [url=https://vndb.org/g709]Kinetic novel[/url], which is a sub-genre of visual novels that doesn't present any choice at all, there is a single storyline and the only interaction is to read and advance through the dialogues.

This is will be an opinion-based review, like most of them here, just wanted to make it clear that I will not be objective with this. Also, for the record, this is the first visual novel that I've ever played.

That being said, I will put it simple, there are three main aspects to consider here: art, music, characters & story (ok, that's four, but characters and story fall into the same block).

The art is really good, though in-game is not as much good as the opening and promotional video. But that's true also for many other games when comparing the cinematic scenes with actual in-game graphics.

The music really fits with every scene, there are really beautiful and pleasant music as well as music for tense situations.

About the characters I have to say that at least some of them are very generic, but it's really hard to stand out and came with something new nowadays, not matter how you try to setup the character. In its favour it has a good character development through the story.

Finally, about the story itself. All I have to say is that it is a really good story, very touchy and sad. But a bit predictable.

Overall, It's a good VN, but not worth the full price.

Now, what I'm going to say is a bit off-topic but... This would be better told in the form of an anime or a book. In fact, I don't get what's the purpose of Kinetic novels. In visual novels in general, they get rid of most part of the narrative that would be there in a book in favour of the imagery. But, there's a little problem, they won't draw every detail of every scene, instead they draw some generic poses for each character and some specific for important scenes. It implies that there are some scenes that are briefly described by the narrative but the imagery doesn't fully match. And that feels very weird to me.

For example: the narrative says something among the lines: "I grabbed her shoulders and asked ...". There you see an image of a girl, but there is nobody grabbing her, that detail just wasn't drawn, which renders the scene a bit awkward.

I think I would have enjoyed this story better either as a book with full narrative or a full animated movie. Kinetic novels are a step in between the two formats but I just don't see the point. With other novels at least your choices influence the story, which gives them some re-playability and it makes more sense to use this format for multiple storylines.

I'm still a visual novel noob & this is not a genre I usually play. I think a pro/con list will best describe my feelings on this one:

PROS:
 - Decent story
 - Good artwork
 - No cringeworthy language translations
 - Great & funny moments

CONS:
 - Some strange character traits (Robotic Ryou & boob comments at inopportune moments)
 - A little too long, I'd personally reached my full emotional range halfway through
 - Same story could easily be told in far less time with same impact
 - No English dub (that I could find, I'm pretty new here...)

Overall, highly recommended for those that prefer this method of storytelling. Accessible for casual gamers but not a must-play.

39476550.review:
先说点碎碎念。断断续续推了好久，终于在昨天推完了eden*。应该说是被长文gal惯坏了，再见这种短篇反而不太适应。再加上前段时间eden进包，价格疯降至5元，着实让我这种原价购买的老年人心滴血了好久，说好的日呆不打折呢！！对于eden本身，我之前并没有了解过，得益于ef的超高质量，让我对中二社（不是现在的巨乳社）有着狂热的信心，有次看了中二社的op合集之后，深深地被eden折服了。op太具冲击性，精美的的画面，紧扣主题的音乐，带给我的震撼甚至超过了ef的天使的阶梯，特别是在高潮的那幕。深陷牢笼的sion终于迎来了向她伸出手的人，ryou牵着sion带着她冲破牢笼，随后两人奔跑在无边的草原上，此刻sion的笑容是那么美。以下内容涉及剧透，谨慎阅读[spoiler] “即使是被关在鸟笼中，长着翅膀的鸟还是向往着飞向天空，但如果不能展翅高飞的话，那就已经无法被称作鸟了”，贯穿全op的凤蝶便是sion的化身，美丽而易碎。为了自由，她毅然选择了折翼，即使这样做后她的生命即将走向尽头。但她终究在这短暂的时间里体验到了作为人类的快乐。能够在爱人的陪伴下，在只属于他们两人的eden（伊甸）中等待着自己生命和世界的终结，可以没有遗憾的离开世界，是她最初的也是世界上最后的恋爱物语。eden在一个宏大的背景（人类逃亡计划）下讲述了一个平凡的故事，无关拯救世界，无关海誓山盟，看似浪费了剧本，但在我心中，却是绝妙的处理。在末日中，我们都是那么渺小，不是所有人都能去拯救世界。那作为普通人，不正是这样的平凡故事更能走进我们内心么？	[/spoiler]希望这部作品能改变大家对 gal = 社保游戏 的印象，即使没有兴趣玩的朋友，也推荐去看看eden的op（steam上的就别看了，画质太低，各个视频网站上搜eden就有），真的很棒 ，毕竟[spoiler] 在op烧钱是中二社的传统，sppl烧了一个亿，差点导致了中二社的破产	[/spoiler]最后
晚安，诗音

40821659.review:
eden* is a tragic story about a soldier who spent his life on the frontlines, yet he finds something unexpected at the end of his duty.

The visuals are generally well done, although some of the character images seem to be slightly off in comparison to their other poses.

The audio, music and sound are well done in this Visual Novel; yet nothing out of the ordinary for a VN.

The storyline, albeit it could be called a bit cheesy at points, is a rather sad one. 

eden*'s only downside would be the execution. Under Windows 10 it refuses (at least for me) to run in fullscreen despite the option to set it with no option to set the resolution. You will likely be forced to read this VN in a rather small window.

All in all, I'd give this VN a 7/10. While being good, it is, apart from the storyline, completely average.

40781139.review:
[h1]正经评测：末世と少女と邂逅と最后の伊甸园[/h1]

关于本作，我很早之前玩了盗版，后来Steam上补了票，然后一直收藏着没玩，最近突然想刷一下本作的Steam集换卡牌才拿出来。目前游戏正挂在后台自动播放，配合耳机双声道食用，当广播剧听。(>_<)

本作是我玩的第一个没有选项、没有分支、没有多周目的VN系Gal。
它让我第一次认识到，原来Gal也可以这般文艺。在其激励下我又接着推完了诸如星之梦、水仙、悠久之翼等视觉小说。

私以为，VN (Visual Novel) 与传统ADV（冒险文字）系Gal还是有很大区别的，因为没有了分支选项等设定，相比ADV，VN的带入感无疑会差一点。
你所看到的故事、故事的人物、人物的命运都是的，你不能创建角色，不能干预角色，不能引导角色，只能看着作者给你准备好的故事，与角色一同迈向决定好的命运。
但牺牲的带入感，换来的是精彩的叙事：
角色的选择不可干预，换来更为鲜明的性格塑造；
故事的走向没有分支，换来更为精致的主线剧情；
游戏的结局不能重来，换来更为珍重的感情与记忆。

当然，纵使没有选项、分支、多周目这些设定，VN也仍然是游戏而不是小说、电影，有着其独特的魅力，eden*向我展示了这一点。
 精致的CG使得整部作品犹如一本精装画册，精美的原声又如此契合着剧情的发展、人物的心境，而包括男主在内的全角色的声优演出，就如开头所说的，甚至可以让人拿来当广播剧听。[spoiler]虽然并听不懂几句~(￣▽￣)~[/spoiler]
在此之上，更有着足以单独著成一部动人心弦的小说的剧本[spoiler]与可爱的小姐姐[/spoiler]，探讨末世、伦理、爱情、救赎等题材[spoiler]与可爱的小姐姐[/spoiler]，唯美、治愈[spoiler]致郁？[/spoiler]、文艺[spoiler]中二？[/spoiler]，[spoiler]可爱的小姐姐[/spoiler]，实可谓难得的佳作。

提到末世、伦理、爱情、救赎[spoiler]与可爱的小姐姐[/spoiler]，自然会想到另一部作品，上文也提到过的：《星之梦》。同为VN系Gal，与本作无论是在手法、气质，还是题材、立意上都有相近之处。女主都同样的孤单可爱而令人生怜，男主都同样从一无所知到义无反顾，剧情上都同样节奏平缓温馨而淡然，立意上都思考着人与造物的伦理与纲常，最后的结局，都同样悲情浪漫又另人释然。与其说这些都是巧合，不如说，是末日、少女、邂逅，这些词组合在一起的作品，与生俱来的气质。比方说，如果我下篇评测就叫做：《planetarian: 末世と少女と邂逅と最后の天文馆》，是不是也毫无维和感呢。

最后，当然不能忘了：
おやすみ　シオン
晚　　安，诗　音

40326675.review:
Basically an onion-cutting-simulator where you also get to take the onion pieces to rub them into your eyes as well. Meaning it will make you cry. A lot.

eden* is a kinetic novel (you just read it, but don't make choices to influence or change the story or ending) which will - depending on your reading speed - take you about 9 hours to complete.

The first hour or so can be a bit jarring, as there's a lot of exposition without anything significant happening, but it soon starts to get a lot better - I promise! ;)
I'm not going into the story here in detail as I'd say it's far more enjoyable the less you actually know about it. In short, it's about the end of the world, guilt, redemption and love, done in a very sincere and natural way.

Even though the art style may look a bit dated by now, the artwork itself is nicely done and diverse. In fact, most sequences look like what you would consider CGs in other VNs. The characters also blink and there is mouth movement when they talk. This might seem like no big deal, but it actually helps making everything feel a lot more alive as compared to other VN.
The (Japanese) voice acting is great and manages to carry over all those emotions flawlessly, accompanied by the beautiful music.

In short, you owe it to yourself to read it, if you care about emotional stories, likeable and interesting characters and a great audiovisual presentation throughout. It may or may not change your life, but the story and characters will most certainly stick with you forever.
Now where did I put that handkerchief again...?

40291112.review:
汉化已经有不少人发布了，我这里就发一个PM补丁吧。
PM补丁的内容是四个独立的R18剧情，分别是关于诗音，拉维，艾莉卡以及真野的内容。
推荐汉化推完游戏本体后再使用，下载后全部复制到eden*游戏文件夹即可。
链接：[spoiler]https://pan.baidu.com/s/1hueqQ1Y 密码：y5n3	[/spoiler]
[b]PM补丁未实现游戏内汉化，但是有汉化的文档，在意剧情的需要用汉化文档对比阅读。[/b]

另外再注明几点（基于先使用汉化补丁再使用PM补丁的情况）：
1.覆盖法的汉化补丁不会影响PM补丁的使用。
2.通过steam打开的的eden*（也就是汉化补丁里的[i]eden_en[/i]）是无法玩到PM内容的，需要在eden*游戏文件夹内打开应用程序[i]eden[/i]才能玩到PM的内容[b]且不会计入到eden*的游戏时间[/b]。
3.如果打不开文件夹内的[i]eden[/i]，则缺少注册表，解决方法详见PM补丁内的[i]注册表解决方法[/i]。
4.PM内容需要推完主线后才能使用，通过游戏主界面的[i]PLUS+MOSAIC[/i]一栏进入，如果是灰色的无法点进去则说明你未推完主线。

当初我也是推完游戏后特别感动，无意中浏览了下游戏里面给的链接，发现还有一个R18的版本，里面有额外的剧情，也就是这个PM补丁里的内容。为了能够玩上这个剧情，搞了整整两天也没搞好，晚上累的想放弃，找资源和解决注册表的问题真的是困扰了我大半天，上面的4点注明正是我呕心沥血两天才发现的，最终在成功能玩到的那一刻，我觉得我没有辜负这两天的劳累。同时我想肯定会有和我一样的真爱粉，为了避免那些我所经历的麻烦和绝望，我写下这篇测评，虽说其实是是指南，但是测评能让更多的人看见。

最后
[h1]我永远喜欢诗音.jpg[/h1]

40223384.review:
我喜欢《eden*》

这是一款精致的游戏。图片，音乐，动画，制作得十分用心。
尤其喜欢一曲《lear earth》，淡淡的孤独中，流露出积极向上的希望与力量。
悲剧结局震撼人心，“晚安，诗音”令我泪目。

美中不足在于故事本身。个人非常欣赏结尾对于诗音逝去的描写，但总体来看，作品的内涵和张弛的设计均不算出彩。

以Minori的用心和投入，如果能恰当地压缩故事长度，《eden*》或许会由佳作升华为“神作”罢。

40196254.review:
前几年曾经下载过盗版，当时看了个开头我就关了。[spoiler] 男主一开始就是给女主挖墓坑这种展开我接受不了[/spoiler]

如果我没记错的话，这应该是我玩过的galgame里面唯一用倒叙手法的，从一开始玩家就知道了结局，而且在剧情中间还会多次有插叙的内容，可以说写剧本的人当年学语文肯定学得很好= =

对于一个人来说，如果拥有了百年的寿命，其实已经算是善终，毕竟对人类来说已经算是高龄，没有理由算得上是“悲剧”。但eden的高明之处就在于，哪怕你意识到这一点，还是会为“高龄”的女主流下眼泪。

剧透慎看：[spoiler]在末世的背景设定下，整个人类都是一个悲剧，这个世界观可以说得很大，成为一部人类的史诗之作，但是官方只选择了一个军人和一个少女的故事，讲述他们如何相遇，相知，相扶，相约，最后赴死。女主虽然活了一百年，但和男主的相识不到一年，在这之前的光阴，都是为救世主的责任而活，让整个人类的悲剧得以避免，但唯独，她拯救不了自己。[/spoiler]

这游戏的OP真是神曲，在游戏里面多处采用变奏作为BGM，气氛渲染满分，没有路线选择，没有多结局，你可以像看一部爱情电影那样去看待这个游戏，感受出色音乐衬托下的故事，人物的立绘以及画面哪怕放在今天来说也绝对不逊色。eden的优秀足以为galgame正名，不是所有的作品都是为下半身服务，它能触动灵魂，让你反思生命的意义。

可以用汉化版本覆盖steam的版本玩耍，但是不能截图，而且最后结局有部分没有汉化（很少，可以在网上找到对应翻译台词），具体方法以及截图问题可以找其他评论的来参考，不过哪怕你玩的是原版，好像这游戏的截图也有点问题。

这游戏在网上能找到官方后来额外增加的射击内容，但是强烈不建议，这个游戏不需要靠那个来增加你的游戏时间以及对它的评价，倒不如说会极大的降低游戏本身的观感。

曾经进过HB包，史低只要6块钱，建议等到这个价格的时候再入手。

最后，晚安，诗音。

40163675.review:
亮　    「已经快晚上了。风都有点冷了……」

诗　音 「我想稍微在这里再呆一会……」

亮　     「啊，可以哦」

亮        「如果困了的话睡觉也没关系哦，我会好好的把你背回家的」

诗　音 「谢谢」

诗　音 「不过，已经没那个必要了……」

亮　    「……怎么了？」

想走着回去吗。
但是，那种体力不允许吧。

诗　音 「我已经，差不多必须要走了……」

诗　音 「马上……要睡了……」

诗　音 「深深的……睡……」

亮        「是……吗……」

就算不听下去，我也明白了诗音说的意思。
她，明白了。
自己的事情，她比任何人都清楚的明白。

诗　音 「对不起……」

诗　音 「要把亮……一个人丢下……」

亮　    「我绝对会遵守……和你的约定」

亮       「因为我正是为此……留在这里……」

对于现状，我只是如此说着。
诗音微弱的笑着，从口袋里取出小盒子。

亮　    「你一直带着吗」

诗　音 「嗯，总有……这种预感……」

亮　    「这也一起……？」

诗音沉默的点头，递出小盒子。
我点着头收下。

诗　音 「谢谢你，亮……」

诗　音 「真的，谢谢你……」

又是“对不起”和“谢谢”一类的。
但是，我想听的不是这个。
我想看的，不是这种悲伤的笑容……

诗　音 「啊……」

诗　音 「已经……不能再这样说话了……」

亮　    「什么都可以……说吧」

亮　    「让我……多听一点你的声音……」

诗　音 「嗯……亮……我也……」

眼泪不住的从眼睛里留下

诗　音 「我也想……和亮多说……」

诗　音 「不想做梦……只要和亮在一起……」

诗　音 「就算谁都不在，只要有亮……」

她的泪水无法停住。
什么都做不到一一
除了拭去她的泪水，什么都做不到。

诗　音 「我讨厌……这种最后……」

亮　    「我在这里，诗音也不是还在这里吗」

诗　音 「永远……在亮的身边……」

丝丝细语随风消散。
毫无踪迹。
在夕阳下，万物即将消失……。

诗　音 「煎鸡蛋，做不出来了……对不起……」

诗　音 「我的任性……对不起……」

诗　音 「不能陪伴你到最后……对不起……」

亮　    「可以了。可以了，诗音……」

每次听到这种颤抖的声音，就觉得心里有什么在崩溃。
从她身上消失的生命之光，同时也在一点点进入我的心里。
就算如此，我还是对她微笑。

亮　    「我会陪着你的，永远，在诗音身边」

诗　音 「嗯……我也…」

诗　音 「我的心，绝对不会离开亮」

诗　音 「永远，在亮身边……」

亮   　 「嗯……」

是啊，已经没有任何需要道歉的事情了。
因为在这个乐园里，我们单独两人的时间一一会永远继续。

诗　音 「如果……」

诗　音 「如果，能再一次醒来的话……」

诗　音 「两人……一起……」



言语……中断了。
随之，她的嘴唇再也没有动。
脑袋靠着我的肩膀，闭上了眼睛，
嘴角仅仅浮出笑容。
搂着她的肩膀，我也一动不动。
想永远拥抱着进入永眠的她。
这样就好。
我想，这样就好。
在她进入最后的休眠的时刻，我就在她身边。
就算艾莉卡不在她身边，她也并非独自一人。
她一定不会寂寞的吧。
这种微笑，就是证明。
而且，也是我在这里的理由。
我一直在向往，寻求，拜托的答案，现在就存于此处。
所以，我只能说出一句话一一
只用一句话，告诉她。
亮　    「晚安，诗音一一」

おやすみ、诗音

39824355.review:
Eden* deals with sensible topics such as despair, love, hope and struggle against fate in the most barebone way possible. It is hard to find fault in a story which plays exactly like you know it will play, after all arguing how novelty and originality matter when judging a story is subjective to how much one knows about the genre and the tropes at hand. Eden* constantly plays it safe, never trying to explore unknown territories in an all too familiar and stale genre.

It is difficult to evaluate it purely as a visual novel, since it uses narrative and graphics techniques which resemble an animated series, with shift in perspective, lip sync, close-up etc. and, given the general (subpar) quality of the narration and the dialogues, we could equally associate it to anime and manga and not lose much in the comparison. The list of works that deal with what Eden* tries to narrate is boundless, and arguably each one of those has greater character and precision, just accounting for the Japanese industry; studio minori does not try in any way to revitalize the formula and instead discards any possibility towards new horizons to get back on the safe tracks of the mainstream.

Are you satisfied with a flat, predictable plot where some music and a few tears shed are enough to stir up a mirror reaction of sadness in you, leaving aside any substance of emotion and with a side dish of unfunny and boring anime clichés? By all means, take a seat and enjoy your journey, this visual novel has been designed exactly for you.

39621271.review:
虽然不算多，但我也玩了有十几款gal了，萌新自然是要玩大佬们推荐的神作，像是clannad，kanon，君与彼女与彼女之恋，甚至玩了沙耶[spoiler]（沙耶可爱，想。。。）[/spoiler]，但是留下印象最深甚至改变了我的思想的只有两部，一部是narcissu，另一部就是eden。
他们是有共同点的，两部作品都平静的叙述着一个关于死亡的故事。
narcissu很纯粹，单纯的讲述生死，背景更小，人物甚至只有两个（只谈论第一部），故事也更细腻。
相比narcissu，eden讲的是爱情，涉及到了更多人间的关系，而且是末世题材，虽然背景很大但同时也很模糊，不过对这个故事来说我觉得交代的刚刚好，毕竟主题是爱情，背景太过详细反而显得复杂，故事中重要人物的形象都是通过回忆来充实的，尤其是姐姐[spoiler]（天国的姐姐我喜欢你啊）[/spoiler]。
天门的音乐一向有着极高的辨识度，在游戏中音乐与文字的共同渲染引人入胜，尤其难忘的是sion这首，零星的音效与略显欢快的bgm使我感到眼前的sion仿佛在花园中追逐着蝴蝶[spoiler]（萨满！萨满在吗？！我需要buff！！）[/spoiler]。
在经历了开篇的紧张与隐居的安逸之后，我们迎来了必须要面对的结局，这里自然是故事的高潮，但在我这里不是，
我只想说：晚安sion[spoiler]（sion可爱，不想。。。谁想打谁！）[/spoiler]
